Title: ML Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
About The Role

Taktile is building the world's leading software platform for running critical and highly-automated decisions. Our customers use our product to catch fraudsters, prevent money laundering, and expand access to credit for small businesses, among many other use cases. Taktile is already making millions of such decisions across the globe every day.

We do this through a powerful suite of tools that combine ML/AI with heuristics and logic, flexible data integrations, and an overlay of data analytics. We see a high degree of usability as a key differentiator and have been investing in a world-class UI/UX from day one. To help us deliver our vision, we are seeking talented and experienced ML Engineer.

At Taktile, trustworthy AI & Machine Learning are core components of our value proposition. As ML Engineer, you will use the latest advancements in AI & Machine Learning to deliver custom AI solutions for our global enterprise customers in Banking & FinTech. You’ll collaborate closely with customers, product- and engineering teams to ensure we’re leveraging our core platform and custom AI solutions in the best possible way to address real-world challenges. Your work will impact millions of business-critical decisions every day.

If you are passionate about building custom AI products in production, thrive in a collaborative environment, and are eager to make a tangible impact on financial services at a global scale, this role is tailor-made for you.

About You


You have a background in statistics & machine learning
You have a strong backend programming skill set (Python, RESTful APIs, Databases, AWS Services)
You have experience building & running scalable services in the cloud
You’re a creative problem solver with a bias for action, eager to learn and deliver robust solutions fast
You thrive in a customer-facing role where you solve complex technical challenges while engaging closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive value.


What You'll Do


Use the latest advancements in AI & Machine Learning to automate complex workflows for the world’s leading FinTechs
Make a big impact by building apps & services that power millions of business-critical decisions each day.
Work hand-in-hand with our customers all the way from idea to production
Work closely with our product teams to develop and refine AI modules in our core platform


Ideal, But Not Required

You’ve had exposure to the financial services industry before and you’re excited to solve some of the industries most pressing problems with AI (fraud, money laundering, etc.)

Our Offer


Work with colleagues that lift you up, challenge you, celebrate you and help you grow. We come from many different backgrounds, but what we have in common is the desire to operate at the very top of our fields. If you are similarly capable, caring, and driven, you'll find yourself at home here
Make an impact and shape the new data science function at a high-growth FinTech company
Experience a flat hierarchy and communicate directly with founding team members. Having an opinion and voicing your ideas is not only welcome but encouraged, especially when they challenge the status quo
Learn from experienced mentors and achieve tremendous personal and professional growth. Get to know and leverage our network of leading tech investors and advisors around the globe including the founders of Looker, Datadog, GitHub, and UiPath
Enjoy bi-annual offsites where the entire company co-locates to collaborate in person
Receive a top-of-market equity and cash compensation package as well as access to a self-development budget that you can use to attend conferences, buy books or take classes
Work at our prime office locations in Berlin for two days per week or more


Our Stance


We're eager to meet talented and driven candidates regardless of whether they tick all the boxes. We're looking for someone who will add to our culture, not just fit within it. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underestimated and underrepresented in tech to apply
We seek to actively recognize and combat racism, sexism, ableism and ageism. We embrace and support all gender identities and expressions, and celebrate love in its many forms. We won't inquire about how you identify or if you've experienced discrimination, but if you want to tell your story, we are all ears


About Us

Taktile is building the world's leading software platform for running critical and highly-automated decisions. Our customers use our product to catch fraudsters, prevent money laundering, and expand access to credit for small businesses, among many other use cases. Taktile is already making millions of such decisions across the globe every day.

Taktile is based in Berlin, London and New York City. It was founded by machine learning and data science veterans with extensive experience building and running production ML in financial services. Our team consists of engineers, entrepreneurs, and researchers with a diverse set of backgrounds. Some of us attended top universities such as Harvard, Oxford, and Stanford and some of us have no degree at all. We have accumulated extensive work experience at leading tech companies, startups, and the enterprise software sphere.

Our backers include Y Combinator, Index Ventures, and stellar angels such as the founders of Looker, GitHub, Mulesoft, Datadog and UiPath.

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Renewable Energy
Description:
📌 Job Title: Junior Data Scientist

📍 Location: Berlin, Germany

🏢 Sector: Renewable Energy & Sustainability

💰 Salary: €60,000 – €70,000 per year (DOE)

🌐 Work Arrangement: Hybrid (2–3 days remote per week)

🎁 Core Benefits: Bonuses, stock options, flexible hours, professional development grants, and more!




About the Role

Our client is an innovative leader in the renewable energy sector, with a dynamic team of over 300 professionals and operations across 10 countries. Despite their mid-sized stature, they have experienced exceptional growth, doubling their workforce and expanding their global reach over the past three years. Their focus on leveraging advanced data science and AI technologies has positioned them as pioneers in optimizing clean energy systems and reducing carbon footprints. Joining their high-impact Berlin team as a Junior Data Scientist offers the chance to contribute to game-changing projects in sustainability while advancing your career with a company on the rise.




Key Responsibilities

🌍 Analyze large datasets from renewable energy grids to identify efficiencies and trends.
📊 Build and refine machine learning models for energy forecasting, consumption patterns, and storage optimization.
🛠️ Leverage big data tools to process information from IoT devices and sustainability initiatives.
🤝 Work closely with engineering, product, and sustainability teams to design data-driven solutions.
🚀 Innovate with AI technologies to enhance operational efficiency and sustainability impact.




What We’re Looking For

🎓 Education: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Engineering (Master’s degree strongly preferred).
🛠️ Proficiency in: Python, R, SQL, and familiarity with other programming languages like Julia or MATLAB. Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, or D3.js) is highly valued.
💡 Experience with: Machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, or Keras. Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a strong advantage.
📊 Understanding of: Statistical modeling, predictive analytics, and data engineering workflows, including ETL processes and database management.
🌟 Additional skills: Exposure to natural language processing (NLP), time-series analysis, or big data technologies like Hadoop or Spark is a plus.
🌍 Passion for renewable energy and a drive to contribute to sustainability goals.
🇩🇪 German speaking (preferable).




Why You’ll Love This Role

🌟 Mission-Driven Work: Be part of a company making a real environmental impact.
💸 Bonuses: Performance-based bonuses to reward your contributions.
📈 Stock Options: Opportunity to invest in the company's future and share in its success.
🏖️ Generous PTO: Flexible leave policies to support your work-life balance.
📚 Growth Opportunities: Funding for certifications, advanced degrees, and career development.
🌍 Sustainability Commitment: Work with a team dedicated to green innovation and responsibility.
🏋️ Wellness Perks: Monthly wellness stipends, gym memberships, and mental health resources.
🥗 Healthy Office Life: Enjoy complimentary organic meals, snacks, and drinks in an eco-friendly workspace.
🏢 Hybrid Work Environment: Work from a stunning office in Berlin while enjoying remote flexibility.
🎉 Engaging Culture: Participate in team-building events, sustainability workshops, and green initiatives.




Apply Now

If you’re eager to bring your data science expertise to the forefront of renewable energy innovation, this is the role for you.




Please share a resume here, or to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com




Join a company where your work has real-world impact, and you can grow both professionally and financially. Apply today to be part of a team shaping the future of sustainable energy!

Title: Data Scientist - AI Agents & Generative AI (f/m/d)*
Description:
Your Mission

As a Data Scientist (f/m/d)*, you will evaluate and improve the performance of our AI Agents. This will involve developing evaluation tasks for agent behaviour, fine-tuning foundation models, researching and prototyping new AI Agent features and frameworks, and investigating issues affecting our customers. You’ll develop a deep understanding of the behaviour of our models and AI Agents. You’ll work directly with product engineering and sales teams, leading by example on evaluating and improving our product - from testing new AI system optimisation frameworks to fine-tuning STT models on new languages and accents.

You’ll join the AI & Data Science Team, a collaborative group of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists that own Parloa’s ML Evaluation Platform and the machine learning models that power our product. The team is responsible for keeping Parloa at the forefront of research and development of Generative AI and AI Agent based products.

In This Role You Will


Take ownership of data science and machine learning projects that help us improve our generative AI product suite
Develop and evaluate production Agentic AI systems for real customer use cases
Directly support and collaborate with product engineering and sales, analyzing the performance of our AI products and prototyping new features
Evaluate and train or fine-tune a variety of models, including LLMs, intent classification, STT, and TTS models
Execute Machine Learning research and development projects end-to-end, rapidly turning new ideas into customer facing features


Our Tech stack (AI & Data): Python, OpenAI, LangGraph, SQL, Microsoft Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Eventhubs (Kafka), PostHog, Databricks, DeltaLiveTables, Preset

What You Bring To The Table


3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
Experience developing and owning production ML models and systems. Experience with LLMs, NLP, or information retrieval is a strong plus
Proficiency in Python and experience with using using Python in production
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark) and using ML Ops platforms (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience in leading small-sized technical projects (1-2 months roadmap)
Strong spoken and written communication skills in English


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?


Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +40 nationalities with flat hierarchies and a collaborative company culture
Flexible office policy - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office
Attractive compensation package
Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth
Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities
Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass or Urban Sport Club.
We cover the cost of a monthly Deutschland train ticket.
Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities
And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks
Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity


Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call → Hiring Manager Interview → Technical Stage 1 (Data Science Coding Session) → Technical Stage 2 (Machine Learning Theory & Case Study) → Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa’s voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that’s revolutionizing an entire industry. We’re passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we’re expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Parloa is committed to upholding the highest data protection standards for our clients' and employees' data. All our employees are instrumental in ensuring the utmost care, GDPR, and ISO compliance, including ISO 27001, in handling sensitive information.


We provide equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national origin, disability status, socioeconomic background and other characteristics.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Junior Level - Software Company
Description:
📌 Job Title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer

📍 Location: Berlin, Germany

🏢 Sector: Software & Technology

💰 Salary: €55,000 – €65,000 per year (DOE)

🌐 Work Arrangement: Hybrid (2–3 days remote per week)

🎁 Core Benefits: Bonuses, stock options, flexible hours, professional development grants, wellness programs, and more!

🌍Languages: German Speaking (prefered)




About the Role

Our client is an innovative and rapidly growing software company specializing in AI-powered solutions for businesses worldwide. They develop intelligent platforms that leverage the latest advancements in machine learning, natural language processing (NLP), and data science to help companies streamline their operations, improve customer experiences, and optimize workflows. Their flagship products are built on cutting-edge algorithms that support intelligent automation, personalized recommendations, and data-driven insights at scale.




As the company continues to grow exponentially, they are looking for a Junior Machine Learning Engineer to join their Berlin team and contribute to the next phase of their expansion. This is an exciting opportunity to work on impactful products used by thousands of customers and play a role in shaping the future of software technology within an AI-first company.

With a rapidly expanding customer base and a series of new products in the pipeline, the company is poised for major growth, offering great potential for career advancement and the chance to work with the latest technologies in an innovative and inclusive environment.




Key Responsibilities




💻 Design, develop, and implement machine learning algorithms to enhance core product functionalities, focusing on performance, scalability, and real-world application.

🔧 Collaborate closely with engineering, product, and data teams to integrate AI and ML solutions into existing software systems.

📊 Analyze and manipulate large datasets to identify insights and optimize machine learning models.

🚀 Deploy machine learning models into production and ensure their reliability, robustness, and scalability across the product suite.

📈 Optimize models for performance in real-world environments, focusing on continuous improvement and the impact of features.

🔍 Utilize natural language processing (NLP) techniques for text analysis and language understanding.

🌍 Stay ahead of industry trends, exploring innovative AI methodologies like Large Language Models (LLMs), Reinforcement Learning, and computer vision.




What We’re Looking For




🎓 Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related fields (Master’s degree preferred).

🛠️ Proficiency in: Python, R, SQL, and experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-Learn.

💡 Familiarity with: Large Language Models (LLMs), NLP techniques, deep learning, and cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure).

📊 Experience with: Data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.

🔧 Experience with cloud-based machine learning tools such as Amazon SageMaker, Google AI Platform, or Microsoft Azure ML.

🌍 Additional Languages: Fluency in German is preferable; English is a plus

📈 Strong understanding of: Statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and algorithm optimization.

🌟 A passion for software development, AI, and solving complex problems that drive product innovation.




Why You’ll Love This Role




🌟 Innovative Company: Work for a company at the forefront of AI-driven software solutions, creating impactful products that are transforming industries.

💸 Bonuses: Performance-based bonuses to reward your contributions to the company’s success.

📈 Stock Options: Gain the opportunity to own a part of the company and benefit from its future growth.

🏖️ Generous PTO: Flexible time-off policies to ensure a healthy work-life balance.

📚 Growth Opportunities: Access to ongoing learning and professional development, including courses, certifications, and conferences.

💼 Comprehensive Benefits: Health insurance, dental, vision coverage, and retirement savings plans.

🏋️ Wellness Support: Monthly wellness stipends, gym memberships, and mental health resources.

🍏 Healthy Office Life: Organic snacks, beverages, and a modern, inspiring office environment.

🏢 Hybrid Work Environment: Flexible work-from-home options, combined with a vibrant office in Berlin.

🎉 Team-Oriented Culture: Regular team-building events, hackathons, and a collaborative work environment that encourages innovation.




Apply Now

If you’re passionate about machine learning, AI, and software development, and want to be part of a company that’s revolutionizing industries with cutting-edge technology, this is the role for you. Join a fast-growing, AI-first company with limitless potential for career growth, and make a real impact on the future of software products.




Apply today on linkedin or send a resume to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com

Show more

This is an exciting opportunity to work on impactful products used by thousands of customers and play a role in shaping the future of software technology within an AI-first company.

With a rapidly expanding customer base and a series of new products in the pipeline, the company is poised for major growth, offering great potential for career advancement and the chance to work with the latest technologies in an innovative and inclusive environment.


Key Responsibilities


💻 Design, develop, and implement machine learning algorithms to enhance core product functionalities, focusing on performance, scalability, and real-world application.

🔧 Collaborate closely with engineering, product, and data teams to integrate AI and ML solutions into existing software systems.

📊 Analyze and manipulate large datasets to identify insights and optimize machine learning models.

🚀 Deploy machine learning models into production and ensure their reliability, robustness, and scalability across the product suite.

📈 Optimize models for performance in real-world environments, focusing on continuous improvement and the impact of features.

🔍 Utilize natural language processing (NLP) techniques for text analysis and language understanding.

🌍 Stay ahead of industry trends, exploring innovative AI methodologies like Large Language Models (LLMs), Reinforcement Learning, and computer vision.


What We’re Looking For


🎓 Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related fields (Master’s degree preferred).

🛠️ Proficiency in: Python, R, SQL, and experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-Learn.

💡 Familiarity with: Large Language Models (LLMs), NLP techniques, deep learning, and cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure).

📊 Experience with: Data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.

🔧 Experience with cloud-based machine learning tools such as Amazon SageMaker, Google AI Platform, or Microsoft Azure ML.

🌍 Additional Languages: Fluency in German is preferable; English is a plus

📈 Strong understanding of: Statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and algorithm optimization.

🌟 A passion for software development, AI, and solving complex problems that drive product innovation.


Why You’ll Love This Role


🌟 Innovative Company: Work for a company at the forefront of AI-driven software solutions, creating impactful products that are transforming industries.

💸 Bonuses: Performance-based bonuses to reward your contributions to the company’s success.

📈 Stock Options: Gain the opportunity to own a part of the company and benefit from its future growth.

🏖️ Generous PTO: Flexible time-off policies to ensure a healthy work-life balance.

📚 Growth Opportunities: Access to ongoing learning and professional development, including courses, certifications, and conferences.

💼 Comprehensive Benefits: Health insurance, dental, vision coverage, and retirement savings plans.

🏋️ Wellness Support: Monthly wellness stipends, gym memberships, and mental health resources.

🍏 Healthy Office Life: Organic snacks, beverages, and a modern, inspiring office environment.

🏢 Hybrid Work Environment: Flexible work-from-home options, combined with a vibrant office in Berlin.

🎉 Team-Oriented Culture: Regular team-building events, hackathons, and a collaborative work environment that encourages innovation.


Apply Now

If you’re passionate about machine learning, AI, and software development, and want to be part of a company that’s revolutionizing industries with cutting-edge technology, this is the role for you. Join a fast-growing, AI-first company with limitless potential for career growth, and make a real impact on the future of software products.


Apply today on linkedin or send a resume to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
Job Description

We are currently seeking a new Climate Data Scientist for our Climate Policy Team based in Berlin. You will provide data science support for our flagship project, the Climate Action Tracker, as well as other projects that track and benchmark climate action across different sectors and countries. You will support the team’s analytical work in assessing the implications of current mitigation targets and policies for global temperature rise and understanding what transitions would be aligned with limiting warming to 1.5°C, taking into account what would be cost effective, aligned with sustainable development, and equitable.

Your Responsibilities


You use and extend existing tools and pipelines in order to provide quantitative analyses of global, national and sectoral emissions pathways consistent with the Paris Agreement, including the Climate Action Tracker’s temperature assessment pipeline using a climate emulator model.
You support policy analysts, modelers, and economists in the collection and analysis of varied and transdisciplinary datasets.
You assist in the development of software to enhance the quantitative analyses and modelling critical to the core work of the team. This will include updating the team’s in-house tools for assessing how mitigation action can be fairly distributed between countries.
You provide support to junior data analysts in the team.
When required, you provide analytical support for negotiators from vulnerable countries in various climate and energy related fora.
You contribute to the writing of reports, briefings, and scientific peer-reviewed publications.


Your profile

You Will Ideally Have The Following Qualifications And Skills


A Master’s degree in climate science, engineering, physics or a related field, PhD preferred.
A minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in a quantitative discipline with applied scientific software development and data analysis experience.
Proven and very good programming skills in Python with knowledge on common programming approaches. Working knowledge of Excel is an asset.
Experience in working in collaborative coding environments with multiple team members using version control (git) and unit testing.
An interest in understanding and addressing climate change mitigation at national to international levels, and in working for impact.
A background in climate science, mitigation, energy systems or economics is strongly recommended.
Excellent English writing and verbal skills.
A well-developed sense for teamwork and ability to interact with a diverse array of people.


Our offer


A job with purpose. With us you will work in a team of highly engaged people and with your skills you can make a positive contribution to our work in the field of climate change.
We are a diverse and inclusive team and welcome your application regardless of your gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect that makes you unique.
We are working in a positive and inspiring working atmosphere with an international team. Our Berlin office is located near Moritz Platz in the heart of the lively Kreuzberg, surrounded by a dynamic startup scene.
For the time being, we offer a contract limited to one year. There is a prospect of extension, and we are interested in long-term cooperation.
We will pay for your public transport ticket to Berlin and offer a company pension plan.


Conditions


Application Deadline: The position remains open until filled
Starting date: As soon as possible
Location: Berlin, Germany
Terms: We are looking for a long-term collaboration. We can offer a fixed-term contract for 1 year, with the perspective of extension based on performance and funding.


Please apply with your CV, cover letter and a list of three references in PDF format exclusively using the application form at the earliest. Please indicate in your cover letter your earliest start date and your salary expectations.

Applications by email or by post can unfortunately not be processed. We encourage you to apply using the application form.

We are a diverse and inclusive team and welcome your application regardless of your gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect that makes you unique.

About Us

Climate Analytics is a global climate science and policy institute established in 2008 that delivers cutting-edge science, analysis and support to accelerate climate action and keep global warming below 1.5°C. Our international team is composed of roughly 150 staff. Half are based at our headquarters in Berlin, Germany, and the remainder work out of our five regional offices in Africa, Australia & Pacific, the Caribbean, South Asia and North America. Click here to find out more.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist in Energy Tech Start Up - hybrid Berlin based (f/m/d)
Description:
Digitalization and energy transition in one sentence? That’s what we do at Green Fusion! Our software optimizes heating systems in the real estate sector, helping to combat climate change through digitalization and automation. We reduce emissions and energy consumption, actively advancing the energy transition.

As a Data Scientist, you’ll support our Energy Optimization Team by developing production-ready algorithms that optimize heating system operations. With a basic understanding of heating systems and strong expertise in control technology, you’ll bring essential insights to help us develop effective tools for energy optimization.

Tasks


Data Analysis: Clean and analyze data to identify patterns and trends, uncovering insights that drive our solutions.
Statistical Analysis: Use statistical techniques to interpret data, ensuring the reliability and accuracy of your findings.
Data Science: Create data models to predict heating system behavior and patterns using advanced analytics techniques and machine learning.
Algorithm Development: Create production-ready algorithms and data pipelines to optimize energy system components, reducing CO2 emissions and enhancing energy efficiency.
Collaboration: You will be responsible for the entire process of developing product features, from understanding customer requirements to final feature deployment. This requires seamless collaboration with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, product and customer success managers.
Research Support: Conduct experimental data analysis to refine and improve energy optimization algorithms.
Clear Communication: Present findings in a concise and understandable manner.
Additional tasks: Support our team in creating data models to predict energy time series data (e.g. heat demand, solar production, electricity consumption) and in optimizing energy systems using machine learning algorithms ((Un)supervised and Reinforcement Learning).



Requirements


Location: You are living in Berlin.



Experience


At least three years of professional experience in data science. Familiar with product lifecycles (Feasibility studies, requirement engineering, production-ready tool development, code reviews, feature deployments, continuous maintenance and improvement).



Must haves


Strong skills in statistics, data modeling, data analysis and machine learning.
Educational background in: electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics or computer science, data science, mathematics with a strong background in energy tech.



Technical Knowledge


Expertise in developing prediction models and working with energy time series data.
Proficient in Python, SQL, GraphQL, REST, and data science libraries like Pandas, SciPy, and Scikit-Learn. Machine Learning Operations skills are a plus.
Hands-on experience with version control systems (Git) and collaborative coding practices.
Testing: Familiarity with testing frameworks and quality assurance practices to ensure robust and reliable product features.
Programming Style: Your code is clean, well-structured, maintainable, and easy to understand for team collaboration.
Communication: You are comfortable collaborating and communicating effectively with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, and customer success managers.
Customer Focus: A strong understanding of customer needs and how they translate into technical solutions.
Language Skills: Fluent in English, with basic German.



Benefits

🏠 Flexible working hour models, home office, and remote work.

💡 Ongoing training opportunities – whether through job challenges, our open feedback culture, or sponsored training programs, there are always opportunities to learn and grow.

💼 Employee benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Become1.

🌱 Direct impact through your job – with us, you can actively contribute to the energy transition and fight against climate change every day.

💚 We value our team – that's why regular team events are very important to us.

🙌 The best team that Berlin has to offer – and maybe even beyond. Don’t believe it? Then find out for yourself and apply now!

While we are still considered pioneers today, we can soon dominate the market with you! First in the DACH region, then throughout Europe.

You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and dynamic environment that is passionate and ambitious about actively shaping the energy transition – a goal that can only be achieved together!

We look forward to your application – Fernanda will get in touch with you!
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
Taktile is building the world's leading software platform for running critical and highly-automated decisions. Our customers use our product to catch fraudsters, prevent money laundering, and expand access to credit for small businesses, among many other use cases. Taktile is already making millions of such decisions across the globe every day.

We do this through a powerful suite of tools that combine ML/AI with heuristics and logic, flexible data integrations, and an overlay of data analytics. We see a high degree of usability as a key differentiator and have been investing in a world-class UI/UX from day one. To help us deliver our vision, we are seeking talented and experienced Lead Data Scientist.

That’s where you come in.

At Taktile, machine learning and data science is a crucial component of our customer value proposition. As a Lead Data Scientist, you will shape a growing function to deliver cutting-edge, scalable data science solutions to banks and fintechs worldwide. You’ll collaborate closely with customers, as well as Taktile's customer-facing product- and engineering teams to ensure our platform and AI modules address real-world challenges. Your work will impact millions of business-critical decisions every day.

If you are passionate about applying machine learning in production, thrive in a collaborative environment, and are eager to make a tangible impact on financial services at a global scale, this role is tailor-made for you.

About You


You’re an expert in end-to-end data science solution delivery, including requirement gathering, data exploration, modelling, and deployment.
You have strong experience deploying machine learning models in production, and you’re familiar with the operational demands of maintaining these systems at scale.
You’ve had exposure to the financial services industry before and you’re excited to solve some of the industries most pressing problems with AI (fraud, money laundering, etc.)
You thrive in a customer-facing role where you solve complex technical challenges while engaging closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive value.
You’re a humble individual with a growth mindset, eager to learn and integrate the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.


What You'll Do


Forward-deployed ML engineering: Train, test, and deploy machine learning models that are tailored towards customer-specific use cases in the financial services industry
ML operations: Deploy and maintain machine learning models in production, ensuring scalability, reliability, and compliance with stringent operational demands.
Project management: Lead the delivery of bespoke data science solutions for our customers, including requirements gathering, data exploration, feature engineering, modeling, deployment and handover to customer teams as part of larger customer engagements (pilots and implementation).
Product & AI strategy: Work closely with our product teams to develop and refine AI modules such as off-the-shelf AML and fraud models, transaction labelling models based on LLMs etc. for the Taktile platform, ensuring seamless integration and robust functionality.
Mentorship: Share knowledge and expertise with team members, fostering a collaborative and high-performing environment.


Our Offer


Work with colleagues that lift you up, challenge you, celebrate you and help you grow. We come from many different backgrounds, but what we have in common is the desire to operate at the very top of our fields. If you are similarly capable, caring, and driven, you'll find yourself at home here
Make an impact and meaningfully shape an early-stage company
Experience a truly flat hierarchy and communicate directly with founding team members. Having an opinion and voicing your ideas is not only welcome but encouraged, especially when they challenge the status quo
Learn from experienced mentors and achieve tremendous personal and professional growth. Get to know and leverage our network of leading tech investors and advisors around the globe.
Receive a top-of-market equity and cash compensation package
Get access to a self-development budget you can use to e.g. attend conferences, buy books or take classes.
Use the equipment of your choice including meaningful home office set-up.


Our Stance


We're eager to meet talented and driven candidates regardless of whether they tick all the boxes. We're looking for someone who will add to our culture, not just fit within it. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underestimated and underrepresented in tech to apply
We seek to actively recognize and combat racism, sexism, ableism and ageism. We embrace and support all gender identities and expressions, and celebrate love in its many forms. We won't inquire about how you identify or if you've experienced discrimination, but if you want to tell your story, we are all ears


About Us

Taktile is building the world's leading software platform for running critical and highly-automated decisions. Our customers use our product to catch fraudsters, prevent money laundering, and expand access to credit for small businesses, among many other use cases. Taktile is already making millions of such decisions across the globe every day.

Taktile is based in Berlin, London and New York City. It was founded by machine learning and data science veterans with extensive experience building and running production ML in financial services. Our team consists of engineers, entrepreneurs, and researchers with a diverse set of backgrounds. Some of us attended top universities such as Harvard, Oxford, and Stanford and some of us have no degree at all. We have accumulated extensive work experience at leading tech companies, startups, and the enterprise software sphere.

Our backers include Y Combinator, Index Ventures, and stellar angels such as the founders of Looker, GitHub, Mulesoft, Datadog and UiPath.

Title: Data Scientist - Startup Berlin
Description:
Data Scientist

Cherry Ventures is supporting our portfolio with this hire

Berlin based - m/f/d - full-time

What we do at Plato

Plato is building the digital backbone of the global trade economy. Starting with the $48T wholesale industry, we empower the modern wholesaler to connect their people and data in a single analytics and workflow hub. By leveraging data science and AI, we automate workflows and combat labor shortages, making SMB wholesalers competitive with large corporations.

🎯 Why we do what we do

The future of wholesale is data-driven. Unlike popular opinion, Industrial SMEs are ready to make the step to become more proactive in their processes but lack the technology to steer them to success. Our founders come from a wholesale family and gathered a rock star team of ex-Big Tech, VC, and top-tier consulting companies to reshape the operations of this $48tn industry. Our initial product leverages cutting-edge data science to provide customized demand forecasts and product recommendations combined with intelligent workflow automation.

We are about to create category-defining software. Our primary customers are C-suite executives within large-scale wholesale and distribution businesses. We are committed to helping them enhance their decision-making processes and optimize their operations through the smart use of their data - bringing their operations into the 21st century! But don’t just hear it from us! We are supported by a list of top-tier EU & US VCs, advisors, and angels providing insights from some of the best SME tech companies such as Miro, Celonis, Personio, Workday, Forto, and Microsoft.

🔮 What we’re looking for

As a Data Scientist at Plato you will be tackling the complex challenge of building versatile models that serve multiple industries, ranging from construction and steel to technical and HVAC wholesalers. Each industry presents unique data sets and requires a tailored approach.

You will have the opportunity to develop a variety of models, such as recommendation engines, dynamic pricing systems, churn prediction models, and customer segmentation algorithms. You will be responsible for the entire lifecycle of these models, from creation to deployment, and ensuring they scale across different industries.

Our platform generates a wealth of data from user interactions, and a key part of your role will be feeding this data back into the models to continuously improve their performance. You’ll collaborate closely with our data engineering and product teams to ensure our portfolio of data products provide value to our users.

🚀 What you’d be working on


Develop, test, and deploy a wide range of machine learning models, including recommendation systems, dynamic pricing models, churn prediction algorithms, and customer categorisation systems.
Tackle the challenge of building adaptable models that can be customized across various industries, such as construction, technical, and HVAC wholesale, ensuring that industry-specific needs are met.
Continuously refine and update models based on real-time platform data and customer feedback to ensure they evolve with our users’ needs.
Collaborate with data engineers and ML engineers to build efficient data pipelines that feed into and optimise machine learning models.
Recommendations System knowledge
Design experiments to assess model performance and iteratively improve accuracy and scalability.
Implement automated model retraining and monitoring systems to ensure that models remain relevant and continue to perform in production environments.
Work closely with the product and engineering teams to align model outputs with business goals and deliver actionable insights to customers.
Build processes to efficiently manage the lifecycle of machine learning models, including versioning, experimentation, and reproducibility across different deployments.



🏅 What you bring along


5+ years of professional experience in data science, with a strong focus on the development and deployment of machine learning models.
Hands-on experience with recommender systems is highly valued—this will be a core component of the role.
A strong generalist mindset, capable of owning the full product lifecycle—from translating business problems into data science solutions to building and maintaining models in production.
Experience in building and running machine learning models end-to-end; you will own your models, ensuring they run smoothly in production and are continuously optimised.
Experience with MLFlow for model tracking and lifecycle management is desirable.
Hands-on experience with data engineering tools and platforms; a background in Databricks is highly valued.
Familiarity with NLP techniques is a plus, especially for customer segmentation and categorisation tasks.
Ability to wear multiple hats and thrive in a startup environment where flexibility and initiative are key.
Proficiency in German is plus.
Based in Germany/EU: We are unfortunately not able to sponsor visas - for this role, you will need to possess an existing EU/German work permit.



🛠️ The tools you will be using


Python
PySpark
Databricks
MLFlow
Model Serving Technologies
CI/CD Tools (e.g., Jenkins, Git)
Cloud Platforms (AWS)
Data Engineering Tools (Apache Spark, DBT)



🗒 Hiring Process

Step 1: Intro call (30 min.) - Oliver


Intro call with one of the founders to get to know each other and introduce Plato.



Step 2: System design call - Oliver + Nikolai


Technical interview with Nikolai, Backend Lead



Step 3: Technical fit - in office


2 technical 1 hour long interviews



Step 4: Meet the founders


Meet the other co-founders



Step 5: Reference checks


Before sending the offer, we ask you to provide 2-3 contacts for us to do some reference checks.



Step 6: Offer


Congratulations! We are convinced by your skills and personality and see a great fit! You will get an offer from us including an appropriate share package.



We are moving fast, and we also want to grow our team fast – that is why we are trying to conclude the whole process within a short time (2-4 weeks).

🖌️ Our way of working


Office: We work from our beautiful and centrally-located Berlin office
We believe working on-site is crucial in our stage to foster ideas and communication
We are, however, open to remote work once a year to escape the Berlin winter

Team: Regular team events and lunches
Tech: Top of the range tech setup
Package: Competitive comp and meaningful equity in rapidly growing startup


🦄 You should join Plato if,


you’d like to be part of a rocket ship backed by top-tier investors from day one,
digitize an old economy with cutting-edge AI technology,
while enjoying the adventurous and demanding road of venture building,
in a team of motivated A-players who push hard to make this a reality



🎯 Our Values


We go the extra mile to leave a dent.
Hustle: We work hard to make our vision become reality.
Purpose: We are here to enjoy the ride and raise the bar.
Resilience: We persevere during challenges and stay optimistic.

We are drivers, not the passengers.
Ownership: We are results-oriented and take end-to-end responsibility.
Proactivity: We initiate new ideas and don’t stay idle.
Velocity: We prioritise action over processes and processes over chaos.

We are obsessed with our customer.
Empathy: We care about our customers and prioritise their needs.
Reliability: We underpromise and overdeliver on customer needs.
Humility: We understand the problem before we seek solutions.

We shoot for the moon no matter if we fail.
Boldness: We dare to push the boundaries of what is possible.
Agility: We think critically and quickly adjust to changing circumstances.
Growth: We stay curious and learn from our mistakes.

We count on everybody's voice.
Respect: We act with empathy, encourage new ideas and keep a low ego.
Transparency: We adopt an honest, direct yet polite communication style.
Trust: We assume every team member acts with best intentions.



Cherry Ventures is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

HTML:
Data Scientist

Cherry Ventures is supporting our portfolio with this hire

Berlin based - m/f/d - full-time

What we do at Plato

Plato is building the digital backbone of the global trade economy. Starting with the $48T wholesale industry, we empower the modern wholesaler to connect their people and data in a single analytics and workflow hub. By leveraging data science and AI, we automate workflows and combat labor shortages, making SMB wholesalers competitive with large corporations.

🎯 Why we do what we do

The future of wholesale is data-driven. Unlike popular opinion, Industrial SMEs are ready to make the step to become more proactive in their processes but lack the technology to steer them to success. Our founders come from a wholesale family and gathered a rock star team of ex-Big Tech, VC, and top-tier consulting companies to reshape the operations of this $48tn industry. Our initial product leverages cutting-edge data science to provide customized demand forecasts and product recommendations combined with intelligent workflow automation.

We are about to create category-defining software. Our primary customers are C-suite executives within large-scale wholesale and distribution businesses. We are committed to helping them enhance their decision-making processes and optimize their operations through the smart use of their data - bringing their operations into the 21st century! But don’t just hear it from us! We are supported by a list of top-tier EU & US VCs, advisors, and angels providing insights from some of the best SME tech companies such as Miro, Celonis, Personio, Workday, Forto, and Microsoft.

🔮 What we’re looking for

As a Data Scientist at Plato you will be tackling the complex challenge of building versatile models that serve multiple industries, ranging from construction and steel to technical and HVAC wholesalers. Each industry presents unique data sets and requires a tailored approach.

You will have the opportunity to develop a variety of models, such as recommendation engines, dynamic pricing systems, churn prediction models, and customer segmentation algorithms. You will be responsible for the entire lifecycle of these models, from creation to deployment, and ensuring they scale across different industries.

Our platform generates a wealth of data from user interactions, and a key part of your role will be feeding this data back into the models to continuously improve their performance. You’ll collaborate closely with our data engineering and product teams to ensure our portfolio of data products provide value to our users.

🚀 What you’d be working on

  • Develop, test, and deploy a wide range of machine learning models, including recommendation systems, dynamic pricing models, churn prediction algorithms, and customer categorisation systems.
  • Tackle the challenge of building adaptable models that can be customized across various industries, such as construction, technical, and HVAC wholesale, ensuring that industry-specific needs are met.
  • Continuously refine and update models based on real-time platform data and customer feedback to ensure they evolve with our users’ needs.
  • Collaborate with data engineers and ML engineers to build efficient data pipelines that feed into and optimise machine learning models.
  • Recommendations System knowledge
  • Design experiments to assess model performance and iteratively improve accuracy and scalability.
  • Implement automated model retraining and monitoring systems to ensure that models remain relevant and continue to perform in production environments.
  • Work closely with the product and engineering teams to align model outputs with business goals and deliver actionable insights to customers.
  • Build processes to efficiently manage the lifecycle of machine learning models, including versioning, experimentation, and reproducibility across different deployments.


🏅 What you bring along

  • 5+ years of professional experience in data science, with a strong focus on the development and deployment of machine learning models.
  • Hands-on experience with recommender systems is highly valued—this will be a core component of the role.
  • A strong generalist mindset, capable of owning the full product lifecycle—from translating business problems into data science solutions to building and maintaining models in production.
  • Experience in building and running machine learning models end-to-end; you will own your models, ensuring they run smoothly in production and are continuously optimised.
  • Experience with MLFlow for model tracking and lifecycle management is desirable.
  • Hands-on experience with data engineering tools and platforms; a background in Databricks is highly valued.
  • Familiarity with NLP techniques is a plus, especially for customer segmentation and categorisation tasks.
  • Ability to wear multiple hats and thrive in a startup environment where flexibility and initiative are key.
  • Proficiency in German is plus.
  • Based in Germany/EU: We are unfortunately not able to sponsor visas - for this role, you will need to possess an existing EU/German work permit.


🛠️ The tools you will be using

  • Python
  • PySpark
  • Databricks
  • MLFlow
  • Model Serving Technologies
  • CI/CD Tools (e.g., Jenkins, Git)
  • Cloud Platforms (AWS)
  • Data Engineering Tools (Apache Spark, DBT)


🗒 Hiring Process

Step 1: Intro call (30 min.) - Oliver

  • Intro call with one of the founders to get to know each other and introduce Plato.


Step 2: System design call - Oliver + Nikolai

  • Technical interview with Nikolai, Backend Lead


Step 3: Technical fit - in office

  • 2 technical 1 hour long interviews


Step 4: Meet the founders

  • Meet the other co-founders


Step 5: Reference checks

  • Before sending the offer, we ask you to provide 2-3 contacts for us to do some reference checks.


Step 6: Offer

  • Congratulations! We are convinced by your skills and personality and see a great fit! You will get an offer from us including an appropriate share package.


We are moving fast, and we also want to grow our team fast – that is why we are trying to conclude the whole process within a short time (2-4 weeks).

Title: Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

Personio is experiencing rapid growth, and with it comes an increased need for data to inform our Revenue and Success (R&S) department’s strategies.

As a Data Scientist supporting R&S, you’ll play a vital role in uncovering actionable insights that drive our mission forward. You excel at analyzing data to understand the why behind trends and uncovering causal relationships that shape strategic decisions. By leveraging your expertise in statistics, machine learning, and data, you’ll create impactful data products that solve real-world challenges.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Measurement: Focus on identifying and tracking the right metrics to distinguish meaningful signals from noise, providing clearer insights for impactful decisions.
Data Products Ownership: Take full ownership of data products, from ideation through production, with a commitment to continuous improvement rather than delivering one-off models.
strong>Team Collaboration and Tooling: Enhance the data science team’s effectiveness by improving tools, infrastructure, A/B testing frameworks, and model deployment capabilities.
Data Enrichment: Lead the collection and integration of new data sources in alignment with the Data department’s strategic goals, enhancing insight quality and model performance.
Advanced Analytics: Leverage statistical and machine learning methods to produce actionable insights that directly drive strategic business decisions.
Clear Communication: Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clarity and alignment across the organization.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


A university degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field
4+ years of experience working with data to solve business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders
Proven ability to use statistical analysis and causal inference to drive evidence-based decisions
Critical thinking skills with the ability to distill company strategy, team goals, and specific needs into an actionable strategy and execution plan
Proficiency in experimentation, statistical inference, prediction models, and probabilistic reasoning
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (Python, Scala or R)
Prior experience with MLOps is a plus


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
Show more

Title: Data Science and Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Feniska is a Berlin-based startup that develops IoT products for cats, enabling data tracking of essential health metrics. Our flagship product, the Feniska Base, is a smart gadget placed under the litter box to monitor key health indicators. The Feniska app delivers daily updates and actionable insights, helping pet owners proactively manage their cats' health.

We are seeking a Data Science and Machine Learning Engineer who is proficient in Python, experienced in machine learning, data engineering, and analytics, and has a passion for pet health technology. You should be a problem-solver who approaches challenges analytically and creatively to deliver measurable results. Strong team collaboration skills are essential, as you'll be working closely with cross-functional teams, including product, engineering, and veterinary experts. We value adaptability to new technologies and the fast-paced demands of a growing startup. A user-centric mindset is crucial to ensure our solutions provide real value and actionable insights to pet owners.

This role will play a pivotal part in driving innovation, refining data annotation processes, developing predictive models, and incorporating generative AI to enhance our health monitoring capabilities.

Tasks

Key Responsibilities:


Machine Learning Development: Lead the design and implementation of machine learning models to predict health issues, using diverse datasets for comprehensive insights.
Customer Data Review and Analysis: Perform regular review and analysis of customer data to extract insights, identify trends, and ensure data quality for improved decision-making and product refinement.
Generative AI Applications: Develop and refine generative AI models and prompt engineering strategies to enhance user interactions, health recommendations, and automated insights.
Collaboration and Integration: Work closely with our product team and veterinary experts to integrate predictive analytics and GenAI-based solutions into our offerings.
Feature Development: Drive the creation of new data-driven features and capabilities, from conceptualization to deployment, ensuring impactful user experiences.
Data Annotation and Quality: Innovate and enhance data annotation processes to improve the quality and utility of data for model training and analysis.



Requirements

Technical Skills:


Programming: Advanced proficiency in Python and relevant data science libraries (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Data Analysis & Engineering: Experience extracting insights and features from large datasets, optimizing predictive model accuracy and effectiveness.
Generative AI & Prompt Engineering: Experience building generative AI applications and crafting effective prompts for AI models to deliver accurate and contextual outputs.
Database Management: Proficiency in noSQL databases and familiarity with SQL for data manipulation and retrieval.
Visualization: Strong ability to use data visualization tools to communicate complex ideas clearly.
Cloud Computing: Familiarity with AWS (or similar) for scalable data processing and machine learning model deployment.



Desirable Experience:


IoT & Biometric Data: Prior experience working with IoT devices and health data.
Computer Vision: Knowledge of computer vision techniques and libraries (OpenCV, TensorFlow, PyTorch) to analyze pet behaviors and health metrics.
Production Deployment: Experience deploying machine learning models in production environments.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Company: SR2 | Socially Responsible Recruitment | Certified B Corporation™
Description:
SR2 are partnered with a global consultancy who are looking for Data Science specialists.




In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and statistical modeling to help clients uncover trends, patterns, and insights from their data. You will work on projects involving data collection, cleaning, visualization, and interpretation, turning complex datasets into actionable insights that inform business strategy. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in programming languages like Python or R, and experience with data visualisation and statistical techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient in Python and data analysis libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn.
Familiar with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with Databricks is essential.
Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.




Role

6-12+ month contract with high probability of extension
Hybrid with occasional travel to Munich
Candidates have to be based in Germany
2x Stage interview process




If you're passionate about using data to solve real-world business challenges, we'd love to hear from you.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - AI Agents & Generative AI (f/m/d)*
Description:
Your Mission

As a Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)*, you will evaluate and improve the performance of our AI Agents. This will involve developing evaluation tasks for agent behaviour, fine-tuning foundation models, researching and prototyping new AI Agent features and frameworks, and investigating issues affecting our customers. You’ll develop a deep understanding of the behaviour of our models and AI Agents. You’ll work directly with product engineering and sales teams, leading by example on evaluating and improving our product - from testing new AI system optimisation frameworks to fine-tuning STT models on new languages and accents.

You’ll join the AI & Data Science Team, a collaborative group of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists that own Parloa’s ML Evaluation Platform and the machine learning models that power our product. The team is responsible for keeping Parloa at the forefront of research and development of Generative AI and AI Agent based products.

In This Role You Will


Take ownership of data science and machine learning projects that help us improve our generative AI product suite
Develop and evaluate production Agentic AI systems for real customer use cases
Directly support and collaborate with product engineering and sales, analyzing the performance of our AI products and prototyping new features
Evaluate and train or fine-tune a variety of models, including LLMs, intent classification, STT, and TTS models
Execute Machine Learning research and development projects end-to-end, rapidly turning new ideas into customer facing features


Our Tech stack (AI & Data): Python, OpenAI, LangGraph, SQL, Microsoft Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Eventhubs (Kafka), PostHog, Databricks, DeltaLiveTables, Preset

What You Bring To The Table


7+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
Experience developing and owning production ML models and systems. Experience with LLMs, NLP, or information retrieval is a strong plus
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with using using Python in production
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark) and using ML Ops platforms (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience with owning the ML process end-to-end: from gathering requirements to experimentation to productionisation, monitoring and optimization.
Experience in leading medium-sized technical projects (3-9 months roadmap)
Strong spoken and written communication skills in English


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?


Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +40 nationalities with flat hierarchies and a collaborative company culture
Flexible office policy - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office
Attractive compensation package
Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth
Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities
Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass or Urban Sport Club.
We cover the cost of a monthly Deutschland train ticket.
Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities
And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks
Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity


Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call → Hiring Manager Interview → Technical Stage 1 (Data Science Coding Session) → Technical Stage 2 (Machine Learning Theory & Case Study) → Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa’s voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that’s revolutionizing an entire industry. We’re passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we’re expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Parloa is committed to upholding the highest data protection standards for our clients' and employees' data. All our employees are instrumental in ensuring the utmost care, GDPR, and ISO compliance, including ISO 27001, in handling sensitive information.


We provide equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national origin, disability status, socioeconomic background and other characteristics.
