Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Generative AI & Evaluations Platform (f/m/d)*
Description:
Your Mission

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d)*, you will work on Parloa’s Experimentation and Evaluation Platform and the models and software that power our generative AI products. You will work directly with product engineering and sales teams to help them evaluate and improve our AI Agents and the models that power them. You’ll build services that enable customers to evaluate AI Agents and run experiments. You’ll collaborate with Data Scientists to research and develop new product features - from testing new AI system optimisation frameworks to fine-tunning STT models on new languages and accents.

You’ll join the AI & Data Science Team, a collaborative group of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists that own Parloa’s ML Platforms and Machine Learning models. The team is responsible for keeping Parloa at the forefront of research and development of Generative AI and AI Agent based products.

In This Role You Will


Take ownership of data science and machine learning projects that help us improve our generative AI product suite
Collaborate with product engineering and sales to shape requirements and our product vision leveraging AI and LLMs in line with customer needs
Execute machine learning projects end-to-end: understanding user-facing requirements, data gathering and transformation, exploratory data analysis, model productionization, maintenance and support, continuous improvement
Shape our ML platform (ML / LLM Ops) by defining the requirements and/or designing and implementing parts of it in collaboration with our data platform and DevOps teams


Our Tech stack (AI & Data): Python, OpenAI, LangGraph, SQL, Microsoft Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Eventhubs (Kafka), PostHog, Databricks, DeltaLiveTables, Preset

What You Bring To The Table


7+ years of experience as a machine learning engineer
Experience working with NLP, LLMs and information retrieval; experience with LLMs in a production environment is a strong plus
Strong proficiency in Python
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark) and using ML Ops platforms (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience with owning the ML process end-to-end: from gathering requirements to experimentation to productionisation, monitoring and optimization.
Experience in leading medium-sized technical projects (3-9 months roadmap)
Strong spoken and written communication skills in English


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?


Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +40 nationalities with flat hierarchies and a collaborative company culture
Flexible office policy - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office
Attractive compensation package
Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth
Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities
Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass or Urban Sport Club.
We cover the cost of a monthly Deutschland train ticket.
Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities
And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks
Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity


Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call → Hiring Manager Interview → Technical Stage (Coding Session) + Machine Learning (Case Study) → Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa’s voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that’s revolutionizing an entire industry. We’re passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we’re expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Parloa is committed to upholding the highest data protection standards for our clients' and employees' data. All our employees are instrumental in ensuring the utmost care, GDPR, and ISO compliance, including ISO 27001, in handling sensitive information.


We provide equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national origin, disability status, socioeconomic background and other characteristics.
Show more
HTML:
Your Mission

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d)*, you will work on Parloa’s Experimentation and Evaluation Platform and the models and software that power our generative AI products. You will work directly with product engineering and sales teams to help them evaluate and improve our AI Agents and the models that power them. You’ll build services that enable customers to evaluate AI Agents and run experiments. You’ll collaborate with Data Scientists to research and develop new product features - from testing new AI system optimisation frameworks to fine-tunning STT models on new languages and accents.

You’ll join the AI & Data Science Team, a collaborative group of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists that own Parloa’s ML Platforms and Machine Learning models. The team is responsible for keeping Parloa at the forefront of research and development of Generative AI and AI Agent based products.

In This Role You Will

  • Take ownership of data science and machine learning projects that help us improve our generative AI product suite
  • Collaborate with product engineering and sales to shape requirements and our product vision leveraging AI and LLMs in line with customer needs
  • Execute machine learning projects end-to-end: understanding user-facing requirements, data gathering and transformation, exploratory data analysis, model productionization, maintenance and support, continuous improvement
  • Shape our ML platform (ML / LLM Ops) by defining the requirements and/or designing and implementing parts of it in collaboration with our data platform and DevOps teams

Our Tech stack (AI & Data): Python, OpenAI, LangGraph, SQL, Microsoft Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Eventhubs (Kafka), PostHog, Databricks, DeltaLiveTables, Preset

What You Bring To The Table

  • 7+ years of experience as a machine learning engineer
  • Experience working with NLP, LLMs and information retrieval; experience with LLMs in a production environment is a strong plus
  • Strong proficiency in Python
  • Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark) and using ML Ops platforms (e.g. MLFlow)
  • Experience with owning the ML process end-to-end: from gathering requirements to experimentation to productionisation, monitoring and optimization.
  • Experience in leading medium-sized technical projects (3-9 months roadmap)
  • Strong spoken and written communication skills in English

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +40 nationalities with flat hierarchies and a collaborative company culture
  • Flexible office policy - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office
  • Attractive compensation package
  • Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth
  • Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities
  • Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass or Urban Sport Club.
  • We cover the cost of a monthly Deutschland train ticket.
  • Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
  • Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities
  • And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks
  • Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity

Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call → Hiring Manager Interview → Technical Stage (Coding Session) + Machine Learning (Case Study) → Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa’s voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that’s revolutionizing an entire industry. We’re passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we’re expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Parloa is committed to upholding the highest data protection standards for our clients' and employees' data. All our employees are instrumental in ensuring the utmost care, GDPR, and ISO compliance, including ISO 27001, in handling sensitive information.

  • We provide equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national origin, disability status, socioeconomic background and other characteristics.

Title: Principal Data Scientist - Media Measurement (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

Role Overview

As a Principal Data Scientist at Cint, you will lead advanced analytics and data science initiatives for Data Solutions and Media Measurement product lines. This role involves using statistical modeling, machine learning, large language models and advanced data analysis techniques. Ultimately, you will be accountable for developing and maintaining research methods that align Cint capabilities with market claims and industry standards of measurement. The ideal candidate will possess strong technical and thought leadership skills and will be comfortable working cross-functionally with product, engineers, and business stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and deploy statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and custom analytics solutions to measure the effectiveness of media campaigns.
Collaborates with cross-functional teams to design, refine and automate measurement methodologies for TV, digital, social, and other media platforms.
Lead the research and discovery phases for both new and existing products and partner closely with engineering teams to transition prototypes into robust, scalable solutions.
Develop customer-facing methodology resources and thought leadership. Support business teams in explaining and defending our measurement methodologies broadly to customers.
Independently plan, develop, and manage projects from concept to completion with no supervision, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
Partner with product teams and other stakeholders to translate business needs into actionable data science initiatives.
Serve as a technical leader and mentor to other data scientists in the team, promoting best practices in coding, experimentation, and analytical techniques.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and emerging methodologies in media measurement and data science.
Communicate complex results, insights and strategic recommendation to non-technical audiences through compelling data visualizations, detailed reports and presentations


Qualifications

Qualifications:


Advanced degree (Ph.D. or Master's) in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or Computer Science with outstanding analytical expertise
+ 4 years focused on media measurement, marketing analytics, or advertising.
10+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or related fields, with at least 4 years focused on media measurement, marketing analytics, or advertising.
Proven track record in leading large-scale data science projects, mentoring teams, driving strategy and delivering business impact.
Extensive experience in advanced statistical techniques and concepts
e.g., multivariate (parametric/ non-parametric) testing, sampling theory, weighting/projection, experimental design, regression/predictive modeling, causal inference techniques
Strong programming skills in Python (as statistical and ML package tools)
Proven expertise in advanced Python prototyping
Proficiency with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) and techniques (e.g., clustering, regression, decision-trees)
Advanced SQL skills and familiarity with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Databricks).
Strong understanding of infrastructure cost management, particularly in relation to processing large datasets efficiently.

Preferred Qualifications


Experience in online survey methodologies


Personal Attributes


Excellent communication skills and advanced presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to a large technical and non-technical audience.
Excellent interpersonal skills, able to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Strong ability to analyze complex and large data sets and extract meaningful insights.
A genuine interest in exploring new data science methods, tools, and technologies to create and implement innovative solutions and approaches.


Additional Information

Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)


Show more

Title: Software Engineer - Machine Learning (all genders)
Description:
OUTFITTERY is the biggest personal shopping service in Europe. We’re for those who want a little more substance from style, more guidance and expertise - less rules and less routine. Because we believe that style is an unfolding story. We aim to inspire and empower - not dictate what to wear. We understand that style is a journey, and we’re here to guide the way. Every customer gets a personal selection of clothes, which our stylists create out of more than 100 brands - always considering their wishes and budget. Our customers only pay for what they keep. Our mission is to empower anyone to unlock their true style.

In your role as Software Engineer - Machine Learning (all genders) at OUTFITTERY you will be responsible for implementing, deploying, monitoring and maintaining the infrastructure and software to enable Machine Learning (ML) solutions, e.g., in the area of fashion AI, recommendation systems, and others across all business domains. Together with the data science and engineering teams, you will implement best practices to improve our existing AI/ML infrastructure focusing on stability, efficiency, and scalability. You will apply your end-to-end understanding of ML applications and data product design. All of this in a diverse and international team. You will join a data team of eight data engineers, analysts and scientists who work closely with different units to solve business problems at hand.

Your Tasks


Manage and maintain ML microservices for tasks like fashion recommendations, article filtering, and dataset composition.
Monitor, modify, and improve the software components of these services, including postprocessing algorithms for ML scores, flask endpoints serving the algorithms, deployment processes for services.
Work closely with data scientists on shaping our data driven applications through their entire lifecycle – from ideation and specification, architectural design, prototyping, testing, deployment and integration into productive systems.
Define and follow development and testing standards as well as automate CI/CD related processes.
Communicating design and implementation to colleagues and senior management in verbal, visual, and written media.
Collaborate with teams across the company, e.g., IT, Product, Marketing, Sales, and Finance & Risk.


Your Profile


Ideally, a graduate or postgraduate Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Physics, or a similar field.
Hands-on experience with integrating large-scale AI systems into production environments is a plus.
Strong experience in developing highly reliable, efficient and scalable solutions with Python.
Experience with both relational (Postgres) and non-relational (Elastic/OpenSearch) database engines, or similar technologies. Experience with comparable database systems is also valuable.
Solid understanding of MLOps practices and tools, including orchestration (Airflow), CI/CD (GitHub Actions), application/model deployment (Flask/FastAPI), and monitoring (Kibana/Instana). Experience with similar tools is also considered valuable.
Experience in applying software engineering practices such as automated testing, code reviews and clean code design patterns.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS), Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/Cloudformation) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
Fluency in English, German is a plus.


We offer:


Flexible Working - Flexible working hours in the home office or in the office, you decide! As a remote company, we leave it up to you where you want to work from. Of course, we will provide you with the necessary equipment to get you started.
Working abroad - Wouldn't it be nice to enjoy the view of the sea, snow-covered mountains or a lively city while working? No problem for us! Combine travelling with your work and spend up to 6 months a year abroad.
Mental Health - Our friends at Likeminded offer individual psychological counseling to all of our employees. Challenges at work, conflicts in your team, personal problems at home or you just feel overwhelmed by a situation? Likeminded's team of psychologists is here for us every day!
Team Events - Since many of our colleagues work remotely, our teams don't often meet in person to just have fun and get to know each other better. That's why we try to organize regular and fun team events. On- or offline always depends on the current situation.
Employee Discounts - All employees receive a 40% discount on all OUTFITTERY products. Family and friends also benefit with a 20% discount. In addition, we propose other discounted offers through our cooperation with the Corporate Benefits Platform. Happy Shopping!
Lunch Vouchers - No good day at work without a good lunch break! With our service from HRmony, you receive up to 50€ monthly on top of your salary for your well-deserved lunch break as a tax-free benefit. Enjoy your lunch!


Intrigued? Then send us your application, in English, with your salary expectations and possible starting date. Your contact person is Pascal.
Show more

Title: AI Solutions Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Overview:

We are seeking an AI Solutions Engineer (f/m/d) to drive the implementation of large language models and AI-driven solutions. You will collaborate with customers, engineering, and product teams to deliver tailored solutions, manage project schedules, and ensure seamless execution. With a focus on innovation, you will stay at the forefront of AI developments and translate complex technical concepts into actionable outcomes for diverse stakeholders.

Your responsibilities:


Prompt and finetune large language models
Facilitating customer evaluations and PoC
Develop and manage a detailed customer project schedule
Communicate innovative solutions to our customers and external partners
Understand customer requirements and translate them into project objectives
Stay on top of the latest AI developments to shape our vision at the intersection of market needs and innovation
Work directly with clients to understand their business goals and technical requirements
Draft and deliver presentations on targeted products, demonstrating features and functionality
Design, deploy, adapt, implement, configure, customize and test solutions for clients, fixing any regressions or challenges that may arise
Provide ongoing technical expertise or guidance and troubleshooting throughout a project's lifecycle to clients and stakeholders
Act as a link between technology and clients, translating complex technical concepts into easily understandable terms for non-technical stakeholders
Analyze situations, identify problems, and devise efficient solutions, often in time-critical scenarios
Work closely and trustfully with various departments, including sales, engineering, support, operations, IT, business groups, and end users and key users to ensure project success


Your profile:


You have experience with complex projects and managing their entire life-cycle 
You have fundamental knowledge of ML, and basic knowledge of AI and Large Language Models
Intermediate Skills in Python
Limited User Experience Design and User-centered approach of software solutions OR Limited Backend Systems Applications design
Good understanding of IT Applications and Architectures
Fundamental/Advanced Understanding of Machine Learning and AI
Experience working on customer-facing technical pre/post sales projects or solution implementation projects to enable customer's success
You have a solution-oriented mindset that helps you to solve problems creatively 
You can identify and implement high-impact processes in unstructured environments


What you can expect from us:


Become part of an AI revolution!
30 days of paid vacation
Public transport subsidy
Fitness and wellness offerings (Wellhub)
Mental health platform (nilo.health)
Flexible working hours and hybrid working model
Virtual Stock Option Plan

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We’re excited to find a sharp Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic Data Science team! You’ll be at the heart of developing, optimizing, and integrating ML models and architecture to fully automate Alpas’s core product. Your mission: Fully automate the supplier search at stellar quality. Plus, you’ll get to boost model inference efficiency and set up auto-retraining systems. If AI excites you, you excel at problem-solving, and you thrive in a fast-paced setting, we’d love to hear from you!

What We Offer


Work on an AI-core product, develop cutting-edge ML models and NLP systems for automating the supplier search that drive innovation and deliver real impact
High ownership and responsibility to manage your own projects
See your work deliver immediate results for stakeholders and collaborate closely with our Product team
Work in a fast-paced environment with challenging tasks (zero-boredom-guarantee)
Rapid development with a steep learning curve
Awesome team events and an inclusive company culture with a diverse team
A hybrid work environment and a nice office in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg



Tasks


Build and Maintain ML Pipelines: Develop, maintain, and monitor data pipelines and ML model training/inference pipelines
Model Optimization: Continuously improve model performance and inference efficiency to ensure stability and quality
Seamless Integration: Ensure smooth integration of ML models with other software components
Stay Current: Research and adapt to the latest AI developments to enhance our solutions
Mentorship: Support and mentor junior team members, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment



Requirements

If you don’t fit all the requirements, don’t be discouraged from applying. We are looking for the willingness to learn more than specific skills.


Experience: 4+ years in roles like MLE, MLOps, Software Engineer (ML/AI), Backend Engineer, or similar
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, Airflow, CI/CD, and MLOps tools like MLFlow or KubeFlow or similar
Soft Skills: Strong project ownership, creative problem-solving, and effective communication. You thrive in a team, manage time well, and are eager to learn and adapt
Language: Fluency in English (C1 level)
Nice-to-Have: Experience with NLP, LLMs, GCP, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, FastAPI, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Pytorch, TensorFlow and software engineering best practices



What We Value


Honest, fast, and open collaboration as well as strong communication skills
We hire you because you are the subject-matter expert in your fields, we appreciate being challenged
Ability and willingness to commit to goals and tangible impact
Resourceful self-starters who hold themselves to high standards, have attention to detail, are intrinsically motivated & eager to learn on a daily basis
Proactive hands-on working style with passion for customer-facing tasks
Team members who are excited about our mission & tech



Alpas is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We view diversity as a moral imperative and competitive advantage. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
Show more
HTML:
We’re excited to find a sharp Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic Data Science team! You’ll be at the heart of developing, optimizing, and integrating ML models and architecture to fully automate Alpas’s core product. Your mission: Fully automate the supplier search at stellar quality. Plus, you’ll get to boost model inference efficiency and set up auto-retraining systems. If AI excites you, you excel at problem-solving, and you thrive in a fast-paced setting, we’d love to hear from you!

What We Offer

  • Work on an AI-core product, develop cutting-edge ML models and NLP systems for automating the supplier search that drive innovation and deliver real impact
  • High ownership and responsibility to manage your own projects
  • See your work deliver immediate results for stakeholders and collaborate closely with our Product team
  • Work in a fast-paced environment with challenging tasks (zero-boredom-guarantee)
  • Rapid development with a steep learning curve
  • Awesome team events and an inclusive company culture with a diverse team
  • A hybrid work environment and a nice office in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg


Tasks

  • Build and Maintain ML Pipelines: Develop, maintain, and monitor data pipelines and ML model training/inference pipelines
  • Model Optimization: Continuously improve model performance and inference efficiency to ensure stability and quality
  • Seamless Integration: Ensure smooth integration of ML models with other software components
  • Stay Current: Research and adapt to the latest AI developments to enhance our solutions
  • Mentorship: Support and mentor junior team members, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment


Requirements

If you don’t fit all the requirements, don’t be discouraged from applying. We are looking for the willingness to learn more than specific skills.

  • Experience: 4+ years in roles like MLE, MLOps, Software Engineer (ML/AI), Backend Engineer, or similar
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, Airflow, CI/CD, and MLOps tools like MLFlow or KubeFlow or similar
  • Soft Skills: Strong project ownership, creative problem-solving, and effective communication. You thrive in a team, manage time well, and are eager to learn and adapt
  • Language: Fluency in English (C1 level)
  • Nice-to-Have: Experience with NLP, LLMs, GCP, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, FastAPI, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Pytorch, TensorFlow and software engineering best practices


What We Value

  • Honest, fast, and open collaboration as well as strong communication skills
  • We hire you because you are the subject-matter expert in your fields, we appreciate being challenged
  • Ability and willingness to commit to goals and tangible impact
  • Resourceful self-starters who hold themselves to high standards, have attention to detail, are intrinsically motivated & eager to learn on a daily basis
  • Proactive hands-on working style with passion for customer-facing tasks
  • Team members who are excited about our mission & tech


Alpas is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We view diversity as a moral imperative and competitive advantage. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Role Overview:

I am currently working with a Berlin-based startup that is now looking for a Backend Python Engineer (f/m/d) to join thier growing team and help build the first AI-driven global supplier search engine. This is a unique opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, and tech-focused environment where your contributions will have a direct impact on the transformation of the procurement and sourcing industry.




What they Offer:

A fast-paced environment with challenging tasks—boredom is not an option.
High ownership and responsibility for driving your projects to success.
Direct collaboration with the founder and leadership team.
Steep learning curve and opportunities for rapid personal and professional growth.
A diverse and inclusive team with fun, engaging team events.
Flexible hybrid work setup and a welcoming office space in Berlin.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and maintain backend systems and APIs for our AI-driven supplier search engine.
Work with Elasticsearch to build and optimize search functionality and scalable data systems.
Collaborate with the frontend, product, and data teams to ensure seamless integration and performance.
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code in Python.
Create and maintain robust automated tests (unit, integration).
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize application performance in production to meet SLOs.
Take full ownership of backend projects, from initial design to deployment and operation.
Actively contribute to architectural decisions and improve our codebase.
Stay up-to-date with the latest backend technologies and best practices.




Qualifications:

3+ years of professional experience in backend development.
Strong proficiency in Python and hands-on experience with Elasticsearch.
Expertise in building and maintaining RESTful APIs.
Familiarity with scalable database systems and data processing.
Experience with application monitoring and debugging tools (e.g., Sentry, Datadog).
Proficiency in automated testing tools (e.g., Pytest).
Solid understanding of performance optimization and system reliability.
Strong English communication skills (written and verbal).




What We Value:

A proactive, resourceful, and hands-on approach to problem-solving.
A collaborative team player with excellent communication skills.
Passion for building efficient, reliable, and customer-focused backend systems.
Eagerness to thrive in a startup environment and contribute to the company's growth.
Excitement about the mission of transforming the procurement and sourcing industry through innovative technology.




If you’re a backend engineer with a passion for creating scalable and impactful solutions, and you thrive in a startup environment, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Head of Data Science (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled Head of Data Science to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages advanced machine learning techniques to drive innovation and enhance our platforms and processes. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

Job Description


Drive the development and deployment of impactful machine learning models that deliver business results.
Work closely with Data Science Team Leads to oversee the development of various machine learning topics, ensuring resources are allocated effectively and projects stay on track.
Provide technical expertise and guidance to team members, offering advice on modeling questions and making critical MLOps design choices.
Motivate and inspire team members to reach their maximum potential, attracting and retaining top talent.
Collaborate with stakeholders and partners in the tech department to identify and capitalize on business opportunities.
Advocate best practices in processes, coding standards, and technologies within the data science department.


Qualifications


Proven experience in managing teams or departments, with a focus on technical guidance and mentorship.
Demonstrated track record of generating substantial business impact through successful development and deployment of machine learning models.
Profound knowledge of predictive machine learning models, software engineering practices, and machine learning operations.
Experience or quick adaptability to our tech stack, including Python, AWS services (Step Functions, Glue, Sagemaker & Sagemaker Python SDK, Redshift, etc.), Jenkins, Terraform, FastAPI and SQL.
Strong business understanding and the ability to draw meaningful conclusions from A/B test experiments, providing relevant insights to stakeholders.


Additional Information

Our offer


Colleagues who strive for excellence and utilize the latest technologies. See what we do in our Tech-Blog: https://auto1.tech.
Our dynamic environment offers new challenges for personal growth and encourages the contribution of your own ideas.
More than 100 different nationalities contribute to a truly international and diverse working environment.
30 days of vacation per year.
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development.
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars.


Apply by uploading your CV with a note of your earliest starting date.

Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Data Scientist Lead and Team Lead "Customer Intelligence Team" (m/f/d)
Description:
Axel Springer National Media & Tech is responsible for over 60 products from more than 25 brands and some of Europe's biggest news sites including BILD.de and WELT.de. Together, the websites attract more than 1 Mio digital subscribers.

There are several cross-functional teams that are building exiting products, like ML driven recommendations and personalizations for Bild.de or predictions for the customer lifetime value of our subscribers. We build in the last years an environment that provides all the necessary data to build amazing ML projects on top.

Are you an experienced data science lead, ready to take on this challenge with us? Axel Springer National Media & Tech has made it its mission to reach the next level of publishing - help us to evolve, innovate and accelerate. Join our team to build the next generation of data driven tools for digital publishing.

Become a

data-loving scientist and shape with us the future of our subscription business


you teach and guide a diverse team of Data Scientists on their respective projects and you are responsible for our Customer Intelligence Team, which is driving all optimizations towards our subscribers
you play a crucial role in the stakeholder communication to explain all the "statistical magic" into plain english or german and help them to understand
you become the 'go-to' person for the mechanics of our products and the underlying data
you become an expert for our customers and marketing activities and a trusted advisor for our stakeholders
you become an expert for our recommendation systems and play a pivotal role in making there the next steps
you validate your ideas by analyzing historical data
you design, implement, and analyze A/B tests
next to your coaching and advisory topics, you take ownership for our projects and production pipelines, working hand-in-hand with your colleagues in the team to deliver high quality results
you are a teacher and learner from everyone in the organization
you are an advocate for data driven decisions – explain stakeholders what data we have and how to use it


You are a

solutions oriented team player with a passion for data


you are a data scientist with at least 5 years of experience and extensive management experience
you like to make sense out of huge amounts of data and you want to see your algorithms work in production
ideally you have a phd in statistics
you are a proactive and independent problem solver who has the ability to visualize and articulate complex issues and can communicate effectively with non-technical colleagues
you have a strong knowledge of Python and the libraries for data manipulation and machine learning
you write clean, readable and maintainable code
experience with projects relating to CRM, CLV modeling, churn prediction and expertise in marketing would be a plus
you have worked with Spark, R, Shiny or AWS before
ideally you have worked with Palantir Foundry or comparable managed data platforms
you are fluent in English, German is a big plus (stakeholder communication)
experience with behavioral user data and A/B tests would also be a plus


Benefit from a

culture of personal development, purposeful work, and a fun & supportive team


your personal growth is important to us: we offer trainings and learning lunches, tech conferences, a budget for workshops and much more to expand your knowledge and your skills
a collaborative culture where cross-functional work allows you to explore other developers' domains, and your ideas are encouraged to stay ahead of the market by learning, evaluating, and implementing the latest technologies
flexible working time and hybrid work create an ideal work life balance
30 days of vacation and 20 days for working abroad
free lunch - in our onsite restaurants
free choice of top-notch office equipment, up-to-date hardware, software and modern office spaces
from now a permanent full- or part-time position in a modern office in the heart of Berlin: http://www.axelspringer-neubau.de/


Getting curious? Check out what we are doing on GitHub or check out our Techblog.

Questions and answers about the application process

Contact person for this position (reference number REF2172B) is Marcel Burmester

The most frequently asked questions and their answers can be found on our FAQ page: career.axelspringer.com/en/faq

Diversity is an essential part of our corporate culture! We are looking forward to receiving all applications regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability, age, sexual orientation and identity.

You can find information about the representation for the severely disabled at Axel Springer here: https://career.axelspringer.com/en/rsde

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Security and Privacy Engineering
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

Currently, Vinted’s Security & Privacy (S&P) domain lacks analytics capabilities to quantifiable measure the impact on members (customers) and business. Hence, S&P is joining forces with the Data Science & Analytics (DSA) department. In this role, you’ll be the first decision scientist in the domain. That means that you’ll have the opportunity to shape the domain and help make data-driven decisions. For that, you will define meaningful metrics, investigate the relation between the work the domain does versus the impact on the business (e.g. through experimentation) and improve risk estimations with statistically sound methods. Since there is no Analytics Engineer in the domain, you’ll occasionally have to write some dbt jobs to transform the data you use.

In this position, you’ll


Define meaningful metrics - validate existing metrics and help to develop new metrics which are meaningful for decision making across Vinted.
Quantify our impact - find a way to translate technical security and privacy results to business metrics, e.g. did our anti-phishing efforts help to improve experience for the members?
Risk estimation - improve risk evaluation with more statistically sound methods.
Work on improved detection - provide expertise on tools and techniques for anomaly detection (e.g. fraud, scraping)
Collaborate with Analytics Engineers and Decision Scientists from our Group Applied Data domain


About You


Demonstrated working experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, or other role with a strong data component.
BSc or MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Programming experience (for example Python or R)
Proficient in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.). Open to learn dbt and Analytics Engineering best practices.
Affinity with the ‘Security and Privacy’ practices, e.g. understanding the generic concepts behind privacy enhancing technologies, risk estimation, anomaly detection, etc.
Strong interpersonal skills and a good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences and senior stakeholders
Ability to deal with ambiguity and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Excellent written and spoken English


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Club
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is €69,000 - €93,400 gross per year.

next to your coaching and advisory topics, you take ownership for our projects and production pipelines, working hand-in-hand with your colleagues in the team to deliver high quality results
you are a teacher and learner from everyone in the organization
you are an advocate for data driven decisions – explain stakeholders what data we have and how to use it




You are a

solutions oriented team player with a passion for data



you are a data scientist with at least 5 years of experience and extensive management experience
you like to make sense out of huge amounts of data and you want to see your algorithms work in production
ideally you have a phd in statistics
you are a proactive and independent problem solver who has the ability to visualize and articulate complex issues and can communicate effectively with non-technical colleagues
you have a strong knowledge of Python and the libraries for data manipulation and machine learning
you write clean, readable and maintainable code
experience with projects relating to CRM, CLV modeling, churn prediction and expertise in marketing would be a plus
you have worked with Spark, R, Shiny or AWS before
ideally you have worked with Palantir Foundry or comparable managed data platforms
you are fluent in English, German is a big plus (stakeholder communication)
experience with behavioral user data and A/B tests would also be a plus




Benefit from a

culture of personal development, purposeful work, and a fun & supportive team



your personal growth is important to us: we offer trainings and learning lunches, tech conferences, a budget for workshops and much more to expand your knowledge and your skills
a collaborative culture where cross-functional work allows you to explore other developers' domains, and your ideas are encouraged to stay ahead of the market by learning, evaluating, and implementing the latest technologies
flexible working time and hybrid work create an ideal work life balance
30 days of vacation and 20 days for working abroad
free lunch - in our onsite restaurants
free choice of top-notch office equipment, up-to-date hardware, software and modern office spaces
from now a permanent full- or part-time position in a modern office in the heart of Berlin: http://www.axelspringer-neubau.de/




Getting curious? Check out what we are doing on GitHub or check out our Techblog.

Questions and answers about the application process

Contact person for this position (reference number REF2172B) is Marcel Burmester

The most frequently asked questions and their answers can be found on our FAQ page: career.axelspringer.com/en/faq

Diversity is an essential part of our corporate culture! We are looking forward to receiving all applications regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability, age, sexual orientation and identity.

You can find information about the representation for the severely disabled at Axel Springer here: https://career.axelspringer.com/en/rsde



Show more
HTML:
Axel Springer National Media & Tech is responsible for over 60 products from more than 25 brands and some of Europe's biggest news sites including BILD.de and WELT.de. Together, the websites attract more than 1 Mio digital subscribers.

There are several cross-functional teams that are building exiting products, like ML driven recommendations and personalizations for Bild.de or predictions for the customer lifetime value of our subscribers. We build in the last years an environment that provides all the necessary data to build amazing ML projects on top.

Are you an experienced data science lead, ready to take on this challenge with us? Axel Springer National Media & Tech has made it its mission to reach the next level of publishing - help us to evolve, innovate and accelerate. Join our team to build the next generation of data driven tools for digital publishing.

Become a

data-loving scientist and shape with us the future of our subscription business

  • you teach and guide a diverse team of Data Scientists on their respective projects and you are responsible for our Customer Intelligence Team, which is driving all optimizations towards our subscribers
  • you play a crucial role in the stakeholder communication to explain all the "statistical magic" into plain english or german and help them to understand
  • you become the 'go-to' person for the mechanics of our products and the underlying data
  • you become an expert for our customers and marketing activities and a trusted advisor for our stakeholders
  • you become an expert for our recommendation systems and play a pivotal role in making there the next steps
  • you validate your ideas by analyzing historical data
  • you design, implement, and analyze A/B tests
  • next to your coaching and advisory topics, you take ownership for our projects and production pipelines, working hand-in-hand with your colleagues in the team to deliver high quality results
  • you are a teacher and learner from everyone in the organization
  • you are an advocate for data driven decisions – explain stakeholders what data we have and how to use it




You are a

solutions oriented team player with a passion for data

  • you are a data scientist with at least 5 years of experience and extensive management experience
  • you like to make sense out of huge amounts of data and you want to see your algorithms work in production
  • ideally you have a phd in statistics
  • you are a proactive and independent problem solver who has the ability to visualize and articulate complex issues and can communicate effectively with non-technical colleagues
  • you have a strong knowledge of Python and the libraries for data manipulation and machine learning
  • you write clean, readable and maintainable code
  • experience with projects relating to CRM, CLV modeling, churn prediction and expertise in marketing would be a plus
  • you have worked with Spark, R, Shiny or AWS before
  • ideally you have worked with Palantir Foundry or comparable managed data platforms
  • you are fluent in English, German is a big plus (stakeholder communication)
  • experience with behavioral user data and A/B tests would also be a plus




Benefit from a

culture of personal development, purposeful work, and a fun & supportive team

  • your personal growth is important to us: we offer trainings and learning lunches, tech conferences, a budget for workshops and much more to expand your knowledge and your skills
  • a collaborative culture where cross-functional work allows you to explore other developers' domains, and your ideas are encouraged to stay ahead of the market by learning, evaluating, and implementing the latest technologies
  • flexible working time and hybrid work create an ideal work life balance
  • 30 days of vacation and 20 days for working abroad
  • free lunch - in our onsite restaurants
  • free choice of top-notch office equipment, up-to-date hardware, software and modern office spaces
  • from now a permanent full- or part-time position in a modern office in the heart of Berlin: http://www.axelspringer-neubau.de/




Getting curious? Check out what we are doing on GitHub or check out our Techblog.

Questions and answers about the application process

Contact person for this position (reference number REF2172B) is Marcel Burmester

The most frequently asked questions and their answers can be found on our FAQ page: career.axelspringer.com/en/faq

Diversity is an essential part of our corporate culture! We are looking forward to receiving all applications regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability, age, sexual orientation and identity.

You can find information about the representation for the severely disabled at Axel Springer here: https://career.axelspringer.com/en/rsde

Title: Data Scientist - Organic Growth | Paid relocation to Barcelona, Spain
Description:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.




Meet the team!

At Preply, we're growing a talented Data Team to empower top-notch decision-making across our organization. Our team collaborates closely with various other chapters - including product, business, and platform - leveraging analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning.

As a key player, you’ll be embedded in cross-functional teams, partnering with Product Managers, Marketing, Tech Leads, and the Data Strategy team. Check out our Tech Radar to see the tools and technologies we love using at Preply!




What You’ll Be Doing

Develop and implement data frameworks to enhance our organic growth strategies, including SEO, CRM, and Referral programs
Drive virality and word-of-mouth growth by analyzing user behavior and helping teams capitalize opportunities where we have high user engagement
Generate strategic insights to shape top-level roadmaps.
Collaborate with teams to define KPIs for organic growth and maintain dashboards to monitor performance.
Identify trends and opportunities, providing actionable insights to support team initiatives.
Examples of areas you will cover are:
Collect, organize and interpret, utilizing statistical and analytical techniques, trends, patterns, and correlations from large SEO data sets (internal and external data)
Analyze cross-channel data, particularly in SEO and SEM, to optimize marketing efficiency and prevent cannibalization.




What You Need To Succeed

3-5 years' experience in Data Science/Analysis, focusing on data analytics for business or product growth;
Previous experience in fast-paced Technology or Management Consulting companies;
Proven ability to work with product teams, run AB experiments, and identify product optimization opportunities;
Strong background in quantitative fields (e.g., statistics, mathematics);
Proficient coding skills in SQL and Python;
An outcome-driven approach with a passion for problem-solving and exploring new ideas.
A creative mindset with a proactive attitude, along with stakeholder management and influencing skills;
Fluency in English and eager to work on a global product with a multicultural team.




Nice To Have

Experience with CRM tools (e.g., Braze) and referral programs;
Knowledge of SEO and third-party tools (e.g., Google Search Console, Ahrefs, Adwords);
Familiarity with predictive modeling;
Experience in digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);
Knowledge of Looker, Amplitude, Snowflake, and growth/retention analytics frameworks.




Why You’ll Love It At Preply

An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).




Our Principles

Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Python Developer (m/w/d)
Description:
Your mission

Als Python Backend Developer (m/w/d) bei SIDES sind Sie verantwortlich für das Design, die Implementierung und die Wartung von Backend-Systemen und APIs mit Python. Ihre Expertise in FastAPI und SQLAlchemy wird entscheidend sein, um skalierbare und leistungsstarke Anwendungen zu entwickeln, die ein nahtloses Benutzererlebnis bieten. Sie werden eng mit unseren Frontend Entwicklern, Data Scientists und anderen Teammitgliedern zusammenarbeiten, um robuste und effiziente Lösungen bereitzustellen.

Hauptaufgaben:


Design, Entwicklung und Wartung von Backend-Diensten und APIs mit Python
Zusammenarbeit mit Frontend-Entwicklern zur Integration von Benutzeroberflächenelementen mit serverseitiger Logik
Sicherstellung der Leistung, Qualität und Reaktionsfähigkeit der Anwendungen
Implementierung von Sicherheits- und Datenschutzprotokollen
Schreiben von sauberem, wartbarem und gut dokumentiertem Code
Durchführung von Code-Reviews und konstruktives Feedback an Teammitglieder
Fehlerbehebung und Debugging von Anwendungen zur Sicherstellung optimaler Leistung
Auf dem neuesten Stand der Branchentrends, Technologien und Best Practices bleiben
Teilnahme an agilen Entwicklungsprozessen, einschließlich Sprint-Planung, Daily Stand-ups und Retrospektiven



Your profile

Erforderliche Fähigkeiten und Qualifikationen:


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einem verwandten Bereich oder gleichwertige Berufserfahrung
Nachgewiesene Erfahrung als Python-Entwickler, insbesondere in der Backend-Entwicklung (5+ Jahre)
Starke Kenntnisse der Programmiersprache Python.Erfahrung mit Datenbanken (z.B. PostgreSQL, MySQL, REDIS, DynamoB)
Vertrautheit mit RESTful APIs und Webservices
Verständnis für asynchrone Programmierung und ereignisgesteuerte Architektur
Kenntnisse in Containerisierung und Bereitstellung mit Docker
Erfahrung mit Versionskontrollsystemen, insbesondere Git
Ausgeprägte Problemlösungsfähigkeiten sowie die Fähigkeit, sowohl eigenständig als auch im Team zu arbeiten
Hervorragende Kommunikations- und Kollaborationsfähigkeiten
Deutschkenntnisse sind von Vorteil, um effektiv mit unserem deutschsprachigen Team und unseren Kunden zu kommunizieren



Bevorzugte Fähigkeiten:


Erfahrung mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS, Azure oder Google Cloud
Erfahrung mit FastAPI, SQLAlchemy und ORM
Vertrautheit mit CI/CD-Pipelines und Tools wie Jenkins, Travis CI oder GitLab CI
Kenntnisse in Frontend-Technologien wie JavaScript, HTML und CSS
Erfahrung mit dem Schreiben von Unit-Tests
Erfahrung mit JIRA
Vertrautheit mit Microservices-Architektur und serverlosem Computing



Perks & Benefits

Was du von uns erwarten kannst:


A recipe for success: Wir sind dieses Jahr 10 Jahre alt geworden und sind als Spezialisten in der Gastronomie/Lieferindustrie bekannt. Mit SIDES repräsentierst du einen führenden Akteur auf diesem Gebiet.
Add ownership: Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit, dein Talent und deine Ideen zu formen. Du hast Freiheit und Verantwortung in deiner täglichen Arbeit innerhalb deines Teams.
High-quality work equipment: Du erhältst erstklassige Ausrüstung, um deine Arbeit erfolgreich auszuführen. Im Büro erwarten dich moderne Geräte und ausreichend Platz für angenehme Interaktionen mit dem SIDES-Team.
Hungry for growth: Persönliches Wachstum und kontinuierliches Lernen haben bei uns oberste Priorität. Wir führen regelmäßige Feedback-Zyklen durch, bieten dir Möglichkeiten zur Teilnahme an Seminaren, Workshops und Kongressen.
Perks:
Firmenrabatte (CorporateBenefits), Zugang zu mehreren Mitarbeiterrabatten
Rabatt auf eine Fitnessstudio-Mitgliedschaft
E-Learning-Möglichkeiten
Mental Health-App-Einrichtung: InstaHelp
Snacks und Getränke im Büro

Baking a positive workplace: Dich erwartet ein fantastisches, perfekt vernetztes Büro im Herzen von Berlin (Schöneberg). Klingt genau nach dem, was du gesucht hast? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung inklusive Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestem Eintrittstermin.

Title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
Zur Verstärkung unseres Data Teams in Hamburg, Berlin oder Essen suchen wir Dich als

Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/w/d)

DEINE AUFGABEN


Du bist Mitglied des Data Teams im Bereich Subscription & Tech und gemeinsam verantworten wir dort alles rund ums Thema Data Analytics, von fachlicher Trackingkonzeption bis Analyse
Du bist für die Aufbereitung, Transformation und Auswertung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellsystemen zuständig und stellst eine bestmögliche Qualität der Daten sicher
Du beantwortest Fragestellungen aus den Bereichen Vertrieb, Redaktion und Produktmanagement mit datenbasierten Handlungsempfehlungen
Ob einfache Analyse, Dashboard oder Machine Learning Modell – Du setzt das richtige Mittel für den jeweiligen Zweck ein
Wir haben kniffelige Fragestellungen und Du Spaß am Detail – Du kannst aber auch „pragmatisch“, wenn die schnelle Lösung gefordert ist



DEIN PROFIL


Idealerweise bringst Du mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung mit und begeisterst Dich für Daten und Analysen
Du bist bereits Digital Analytics Expert*in oder hast den unbedingten Willen eine*r zu werden
Du beherrschst den direkten Umgang mit Daten mittels SQL und hast Erfahrung mit mindestens einer Programmiersprache wie Python oder R
Du schaust gerne über den Tellerrand und hast idealerweise erste Erfahrungen mit Data Science oder Machine Learning gesammelt
Du bist offen, kommunikativ und teamfähig, arbeitest sorgfältig, fokussierst Dich auf Deine Ziele und hast ein hohes Maß an Eigenantrieb



Deine Benefits


Innovation trifft Tradition: Du gestaltest die digitale Transformation unserer Mediengruppe mit
Entwickle Dich mit uns: Wir ermöglichen Dir die Teilnahme an individuellen Coachings, Workshops oder (Online)-Trainings im Rahmen unserer FUNKE Akademie
Flexibel arbeiten: Wir leben ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell, weil uns Deine Work-Life-Balance wichtig ist
Teamwork: Dich erwarten ein dynamisches Team, eine offene Feedbackkultur, kurze Kommunikationswege und ein herzliches Miteinander
Corporate Benefits: Wir bieten Dir ein Benefit-Portal mit attraktiven Rabatten und Abos
Halte Dich fit und gesund: Profitiere von unseren Kooperationen mit verschiedensten Fitnessstudios und lasse Dich für Deine mentale und körperliche Gesundheit individuell beraten



Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann gestalte mit uns die Zukunft und sende uns Deine Bewerbung an Steffen Flach.

  • Du beantwortest Fragestellungen aus den Bereichen Vertrieb, Redaktion und Produktmanagement mit datenbasierten Handlungsempfehlungen
  • Ob einfache Analyse, Dashboard oder Machine Learning Modell – Du setzt das richtige Mittel für den jeweiligen Zweck ein
  • Wir haben kniffelige Fragestellungen und Du Spaß am Detail – Du kannst aber auch „pragmatisch“, wenn die schnelle Lösung gefordert ist


DEIN PROFIL

  • Idealerweise bringst Du mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung mit und begeisterst Dich für Daten und Analysen
  • Du bist bereits Digital Analytics Expert*in oder hast den unbedingten Willen eine*r zu werden
  • Du beherrschst den direkten Umgang mit Daten mittels SQL und hast Erfahrung mit mindestens einer Programmiersprache wie Python oder R
  • Du schaust gerne über den Tellerrand und hast idealerweise erste Erfahrungen mit Data Science oder Machine Learning gesammelt
  • Du bist offen, kommunikativ und teamfähig, arbeitest sorgfältig, fokussierst Dich auf Deine Ziele und hast ein hohes Maß an Eigenantrieb


Deine Benefits

  • Innovation trifft Tradition: Du gestaltest die digitale Transformation unserer Mediengruppe mit
  • Entwickle Dich mit uns: Wir ermöglichen Dir die Teilnahme an individuellen Coachings, Workshops oder (Online)-Trainings im Rahmen unserer FUNKE Akademie
  • Flexibel arbeiten: Wir leben ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell, weil uns Deine Work-Life-Balance wichtig ist
  • Teamwork: Dich erwarten ein dynamisches Team, eine offene Feedbackkultur, kurze Kommunikationswege und ein herzliches Miteinander
  • Corporate Benefits: Wir bieten Dir ein Benefit-Portal mit attraktiven Rabatten und Abos
  • Halte Dich fit und gesund: Profitiere von unseren Kooperationen mit verschiedensten Fitnessstudios und lasse Dich für Deine mentale und körperliche Gesundheit individuell beraten


Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann gestalte mit uns die Zukunft und sende uns Deine Bewerbung an Steffen Flach.

Title: Founding AI Engineer
Description:
Consultants worldwide spend millions of hours every day creating presentations. Zapdeck is set to revolutionize this task with powerful AI software that empowers users to create professionally designed presentations in minutes.

At the heart of Zapdeck is an innovative agentic AI technology—the first capable of converting text directly into professional slide designs. Our product features an intuitive editor that enables seamless collaboration, helps users craft cohesive storylines, and transforms them into polished slides ready for export.

The presentation creation industry is a multi-billion-dollar market undergoing significant disruption due to advancements in generative AI. Zapdeck has secured substantial pre-seed funding and is building partnerships with leading companies in the industry. We are now on track to becoming one of Germany's leading AI start-ups.

We are seeking an experienced Founding AI Engineer (full-time) to join us as one of the first employees and help build Zapdeck from the ground up. The ideal candidate is motivated to step up to the mark, build radical new technology that will disrupt the industry, and accompany our company over the coming investment rounds.

You will be part of a team with extensive experience. Our co-founder / CEO Frederik is a former consultant at BCG and our co-founder / CTO Riccardo is the former technical CPO of InsurTech startup INZMO. The role offers a high level of creative freedom and responsibility, combined with an attractive equity share in the company (VSOP).

Tasks


Develop AI features: Further develop our agentic AI solution with fine-tuned LLMs, Information Retrieval, classification models and other methodologies.
Evolve backend: Develop our AI backend based on Python following clean code practices and enterprise-level architectural design patterns.
Build asynchronous systems: Build and maintain asynchronous systems for automation and bulk use cases.
Manage data and models: Collect and preprocess data, oversee model lifecycle management, including version control and performance monitoring.
Drive innovation: Stay up to date with the latest advancements in AI and contribute to our AI and product strategy to maintain the competitive edge.



Requirements

Professional requirements


2–4 years of experience in AI/ML development, with hands-on expertise in training and fine-tuning ML models, including LLMs.
Solid experience with machine learning libraries and frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face, and strong skills in Python.
Experience in collecting, preprocessing, and managing data pipelines for training, with knowledge of tools like pandas or NumPy and REST APIs.
Bonus: Familiarity with versioning, deployment, and monitoring of ML models in production environments, incl. managing AI related cloud infrastructure.
Bonus: Experience with Gen AI applications in media and design, with AI-powered enterprise software, or agentic AI solutions.



Other Requirements


Residency and valid work authorization in Germany, preferably Berlin. Please kindly refrain from applying if you are not currently living in Germany.
Fluency in English, our main business language
Availability to start within a short time frame (e.g., within 1 month)



Benefits


Attractive package of a monthly salary and VSOP shares in a fast-growing AI startup that could be worth several million in a few years.
Opportunity to work independently and creatively in a young and ambitious team team and see the direct impact of your work.
Hybrid working model with the option to work from home or from our office in Berlin Mitte, and flexible working hours.
Possibility to build your own team and take on more responsibility in a managerial role in a short space of time.
Regular team events as well as free snacks and drinks in our office Berlin Mitte :)



Join us to create a disruptive AI product and shape a globally successful company 🚀
