Title: Staff Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Staff Data Scientist at Aignostics, you will play a crucial role in shaping the scientific and technical direction and integrity of our data science platform, projects, and products. You will work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art for digital pathology. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving scientific and technical excellence across all data science teams, ensuring we deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that transform complex biomedical data into actionable insights for cancer research and diagnostics. You will work within the Data Science Staff team.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ machine learners, software engineers, applied scientists, pathologists, and biologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive, and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup, you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take on significant responsibilities, and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

Data Science or Machine Learning? We do both at Aignostics, and are convinced that both are needed for success. You can expect to work on a broad spectrum of topics from deep learning with foundation and other state-of-the-art models on terabytes of data to projects in low sample regimes and very high-dimensional and multimodal data. We have nearly all the data science challenges you can think of for you!

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


You identify promising new directions based on the scientific literature, results from in-house experiments, and your own novel ideas.
You are able to turn these ideas into reality by describing, presenting, designing, implementing, and experimenting with novel machine learning architectures, models, and variants of existing models
You analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
You run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments on a day to day basis
You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other Data Science teams involved in machine learning and translational research
You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
Educate mid-level and junior data scientists to bring them up to the next level
Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code


What We Are Looking For


Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating large scale distributed machine learning trainings; 8+ years of experience with this
Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)


Ideally, you also …


Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


About Us

aignostics.com

Title: Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)
Description:
At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)

Develop innovative machine learning solutions to analyze biomedical datasets of different modalities with the goal of designing optimized molecules and improving our understanding of targets, diseases and patients.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities


Be an active member of a highly interdisciplinary and cross-organizational team
You will develop and evaluate state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms applied to modelling protein-ligand and protein-protein complexes
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams throughout R&D to ensure innovative algorithmic solutions are operationalized and integrated into our discovery pipelines
You will keep up to date with the latest advances in machine learning technologies
You will engage with the broader scientific community through publications, open-source projects, and conference presentations


Who You Are

We are excited about your talent and passion for this position. Attracting the right talent is important to us. We would be happy to work with you to identify and create the career and development opportunities you are looking for - also in parttime. And if you don't meet all the requirements, we still look forward to receiving your application. We are all constantly learning!

Required:


You have a highly scientific or engineering background, with a PhD degree or equivalent
You have expertise in machine learning research
You have a sincere interest for drug discovery and the life sciences
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Preferred:


You have expertise in bioinformatics or structural biology
You are an expert in applying machine learning for characterizing and designing small molecules, DNA/RNA, or proteins
You have expertise in applying, dissecting, and improving upon state-of-the-art machine learning methods. Knowledge of modern generative modelling methods (e.g., diffusion), protein language models (e.g., ESM), modern structure prediction methods (e.g., AlphaFold), or experience efficiently training and fine-tuning large models are a big plus
You have excellent software engineering skills
You have a strong publication record or demonstrated contributions (e.g., open source) for the above


What We Offer

Our benefits package is flexible, appreciative, and tailored to your lifestyle, because: What matters to you, matters to us!


We ensure your financial stability through a competitive compensation package, consisting of an attractive base pay and our annual bonus. In addition, managers can recognize special contributions by granting an individual performance award or top performance award.
Whether it’s hybrid work models or part-time arrangements: Whenever it is possible, you will have the flexibility to work how, when and where it is best for you.
Your family is a top priority. We offer loving company daycare centers at multiple locations, support in finding childcare, time off for the care of elderly or dependent family members, summer camps for children, and much more.
We support your professional growth by providing access to learning and development opportunities, training programs through the Bayer Learning Academy, development dialogues, as well as coaching and mentoring programs.
We promote health awareness and opportunities for selfcare through various measures, such as free health checks with the company doctor and our health platform #machfit.
We embrace diversity by providing an inclusive work environment in which you are welcomed, supported, and encouraged to bring your whole self to work.


The position is limited to two years.

Our target date to fill the position is 01.01.2025 (negotiable).

Be You. Be Bayer.

Germany : Berlin : Berlin || Germany : North Rhine Westfalia : Monheim

Division:

Pharmaceuticals

Title: Research & Development
Description:
We are currently looking for a Software Architect (m/f/d) at our location in Berlin Reinickendorf. As a Software Architect at GEA Refrigeration Germany GmbH, you will be a vital part of our international team, dedicated to designing and developing top-tier digital solutions that are scalable, secure, and efficient. Your expertise will be crucial in guiding our transition from existing legacy systems to cutting-edge, modern architectures. This pivotal role requires a keen understanding of how to craft interfaces that communicate effectively between different systems and users (engineers, sales personnel, and other key stakeholders). You will play a pivotal role in advancing the technological framework of our company, ensuring high-performance solutions. GEA Heating & Refrigeration Technologies is a leading global manufacturer of components for industrial heating and refrigeration technology and other systems, in particular compressors, units, liquid chillers and heat pumps. We offer high-quality technical solutions for the food and beverage, dairy processing, oil and gas, marine and other industries.

Your Responsibilities And Tasks


Ensuring systems are scalable, secure, and performant.
Lead the transformation of legacy software systems to modern solutions, employing best practices and cutting-edge technologies, including cloud services with a focus on MS Azure.
Define and create the correct interfaces between systems, ensuring seamless integration and communication across various platforms.
Collaborate with internal users from different departments and other stakeholders to understand user needs and translate them into system requirements.
Provide technical leadership and guidance to development teams, promoting the use of agile methodologies and continuous improvement practices.
Develop technical roadmaps, architecture documents, and ensure adherence to design principles throughout the software development lifecycle.
Identify and address system bottlenecks, ensuring high levels of performance and reliability.
Maintain a deep understanding of the latest industry trends and advancements in technology to inform architectural decisions.


Your Profile And Qualifications


Bachelor or Master in computer science or another course of study with a focus on information technology
Preferably 5 years or more as full-stack developer you have accumulated extensive professional experience – Software Architecture Design and DevOps are your trade, in which you operate confidently
Excellence in software architecture in a cloud environment (bonus for Azure Cloud)
Comprehensive knowledge of Design Patterns & Architecture, Fundamentals of Data Modeling, Unified Modeling Language (UML)
Profound programming knowledge in a microservice environment with .NET (or Java), as well as web environment (JS/TS, HTML5, CSS)
Reliable handling of current framework technologies, e.g., Angular as well as modern software development tools, e.g., Git, Docker, CI/CD and standard DB Types (SQL, NoSQL)
Understanding of agile development methodologies (e.g., Scrum)
Strong communication and teamwork skills
Proficient in English. German language skills are an advantage


Benefits


A permanent employment contract with 35h full-time hours
Work-life balance through hybrid working
A highly motivated and internationally agile team
30 days annual leave
The freedom to make your own decisions and take responsibility
Individual training and promotion opportunities in a really “cool” company


Apply for this job

Contact us
Show more
HTML:
We are currently looking for a Software Architect (m/f/d) at our location in Berlin Reinickendorf. As a Software Architect at GEA Refrigeration Germany GmbH, you will be a vital part of our international team, dedicated to designing and developing top-tier digital solutions that are scalable, secure, and efficient. Your expertise will be crucial in guiding our transition from existing legacy systems to cutting-edge, modern architectures. This pivotal role requires a keen understanding of how to craft interfaces that communicate effectively between different systems and users (engineers, sales personnel, and other key stakeholders). You will play a pivotal role in advancing the technological framework of our company, ensuring high-performance solutions. GEA Heating & Refrigeration Technologies is a leading global manufacturer of components for industrial heating and refrigeration technology and other systems, in particular compressors, units, liquid chillers and heat pumps. We offer high-quality technical solutions for the food and beverage, dairy processing, oil and gas, marine and other industries.

Your Responsibilities And Tasks

  • Ensuring systems are scalable, secure, and performant.
  • Lead the transformation of legacy software systems to modern solutions, employing best practices and cutting-edge technologies, including cloud services with a focus on MS Azure.
  • Define and create the correct interfaces between systems, ensuring seamless integration and communication across various platforms.
  • Collaborate with internal users from different departments and other stakeholders to understand user needs and translate them into system requirements.
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to development teams, promoting the use of agile methodologies and continuous improvement practices.
  • Develop technical roadmaps, architecture documents, and ensure adherence to design principles throughout the software development lifecycle.
  • Identify and address system bottlenecks, ensuring high levels of performance and reliability.
  • Maintain a deep understanding of the latest industry trends and advancements in technology to inform architectural decisions.

Your Profile And Qualifications

  • Bachelor or Master in computer science or another course of study with a focus on information technology
  • Preferably 5 years or more as full-stack developer you have accumulated extensive professional experience – Software Architecture Design and DevOps are your trade, in which you operate confidently
  • Excellence in software architecture in a cloud environment (bonus for Azure Cloud)
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Design Patterns & Architecture, Fundamentals of Data Modeling, Unified Modeling Language (UML)
  • Profound programming knowledge in a microservice environment with .NET (or Java), as well as web environment (JS/TS, HTML5, CSS)
  • Reliable handling of current framework technologies, e.g., Angular as well as modern software development tools, e.g., Git, Docker, CI/CD and standard DB Types (SQL, NoSQL)
  • Understanding of agile development methodologies (e.g., Scrum)
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills
  • Proficient in English. German language skills are an advantage

Benefits

  • A permanent employment contract with 35h full-time hours
  • Work-life balance through hybrid working
  • A highly motivated and internationally agile team
  • 30 days annual leave
  • The freedom to make your own decisions and take responsibility
  • Individual training and promotion opportunities in a really “cool” company

Apply for this job

Contact us

Title: Data Scientist / Forschungsdatenmanager*in (m/w/d)
Description:
About

Die Deutsche Rentenversicherung Bund ist der größte deutsche Rentenversicherungsträger und damit ein Grundpfeiler der sozialen Sicherheit in Deutschland. Wir begleiten die Menschen ihr gesamtes Leben lang – vom Berufsanfang bis ins Rentenalter. 23,3 Millionen Versicherte, 9,6 Millionen Rentner*innen sowie 3,5 Millionen Arbeitgeber*innen verlassen sich auf uns.

Für den Bereich Entwicklungsfragen der Sozialen Sicherheit und Altersvorsorge suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n

Ort: Berlin

Tätigkeitsbereich

Der Bereich „Forschungsdatenzentrum der Deutschen Rentenversicherung“ (FDZ-RV) unterstützt wissenschaftliche Forschungsprojekte durch die Bereitstellung von Daten der Rentenversicherung für statistische Auswertungen. Wissenschaftler*innen, die zum Beispiel im Bereich der sozialen Sicherung forschen, erhalten auf Antrag Zugang zu den prozessproduzierten Mikrodaten der gesetzlichen Rentenversicherung.

Title: Research Sciences Intern (VISION)
Description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

The Applied Sciences Group (ASG) is seeking a highly motivated and talented PhD student to join our team as a Research Intern. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge research in the fields of Large Language Models (LLMs), Vision-Language Models (VLMs), and Generative Image & Video. The successful candidate will collaborate with a team of experienced researchers and engineers to tackle real-world challenges and contribute to the advancement of AI technologies.

Responsibilities


Conduct research in one or more of the following areas: LLMs, VLMs, and Generative Image & Video.
Design and implement experiments to test new hypotheses and validate research findings.
Develop and optimise algorithms and models for various AI applications.
Collaborate with team members to integrate research outcomes into practical solutions.
Present research findings to the team and contribute to publications and patents.


Qualifications

Required: Qualifications:


Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Strong background in LLMs, VLMs, or Generative Image & Video.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication skills and the ability to present complex ideas clearly.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong track record of success, evidenced by publications in prestigious computer vision and machine learning conferences, including NeurIPS, ECCV, ICCV, CVPR.
Proven software engineering capabilities, evidenced by professional experience, internships, impactful open-source contributions, and success in coding competitions.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
UMATR are proud to be partnered with a software business looking to hire a talented Data Scientist to join their team. In this role, you’ll be diving deep into data to solve key business challenges, from identifying problem areas and designing experiments to driving impactful decision-making. Unlike traditional analytics roles, this position offers you the chance to create real, actionable insights that lead to change.




What You’ll Do:

Tackle Complex Problems: Use data to identify issues and design solutions that drive business results.
Experiment & Influence: Design experiments, run analyses, and influence key business decisions with your insights.
Work on Real-Time, High-Impact Data: Work with massive geolocational and temporal data in real time, across multiple cities with unique dynamics.
Collaboration & Ownership: You won’t just analyse data—you’ll be a key player, driving action and shaping business strategy from the frontlines.




What We Offer:

Challenging & Impactful Work: Tackle complex data problems while building the future of the online delivery space. Our work spans real-time data, varied city dynamics, and cross-functional collaboration.
A Unique Company Culture: We believe in doing common things uncommonly well, thinking big but staying humble, and treating others with kindness and respect.




What We’re Looking For:

Educational Background: A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Experience: 4-5+ years in a data science or analytics role within an industry or research setting.
Technical Skills: Expertise in statistical analysis (hypothesis testing, experimentation, causal inference) using Python, R, or similar tools.
SQL Proficiency: Skilled at writing structured, efficient SQL queries to work with large data sets.
Visualisation & Dashboards: Experience creating clear and intuitive data visualisations and dashboards that influence business decisions, using tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.
Problem-Solving Mindset: A relentless drive to find new ideas and data sources, with a systematic, data-driven approach to tackling ambiguous challenges.
Fluency in both English and German

Title: Research Engineer in AI / Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
EvoLogics ist ein innovatives High-Tech-Unternehmen mit Sitz in Berlin.

Wir entwickeln und vermarkten weltweit Produkte und Schlüsseltechnologien in der maritimen und Offshore-Technik. Unsere Expertise umfasst die Schwerpunkte Robotik (USV, AUV und ROV), High-Tech-Sensorik, künstliche Intelligenz, fortgeschrittene Informatik, Kommunikationstechnologie sowie Positionierung.

Das Unternehmen wurde im Jahr 2000 durch international renommierte Entwicklungsexperten und Wissenschaftler gegründet und ist seitdem kontinuierlich gewachsen. Wir sind stolz auf unsere weltweite Technologieführerschaft für Anwendungen in der Meeresforschung, der smarten Robotik und der maritimen Sicherheit.

Der Mitarbeiterstamm rekrutiert sich aus internationalen erfahrenen Fachexperten, Ingenieuren und Software-Entwicklern, die über praktische Expertise und tiefgreifende wissenschaftlich-technische Kompetenzen in den Bereichen Elektronik- und Softwareentwicklung, Robotik und in der Integration komplexer IT-Systeme verfügen.

Aufgaben


Erforschung, Prototyping und Konzeptentwicklung modernster Deep-Learning-Modelle für Perzeptionssysteme unter Verwendung von Daten aus Kameras, LiDAR und Sonar
Zusammenarbeit mit einem interdisziplinären Team aus KI-Forschern und Ingenieuren zur Entwicklung und Optimierung von Perzeptionsalgorithmen für reale Anwendungen
Durchführung von Experimenten und Bewertung der Modellleistung zur Verfeinerung und Verbesserung von Objekterkennung, Segmentierung und Umgebungsabbildung
Erforschung und Implementierung neuer Machine-Learning-Techniken, einschließlich neuronaler Netze und Sensordatenfusion, zur Weiterentwicklung der multimodalen Wahrnehmung
Dokumentation der Ergebnisse, Vorstellung des Forschungsfortschritts und Beitrag zur wissenschaftlichen Gemeinschaft durch Whitepapers und Veröffentlichungen
Arbeiten in einer fortschrittlichen Umgebung mit modernsten Werkzeugen und Ressourcen


Profil


Ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik, Ingenieurwesen, Mathematik oder vergleichbar
Erfahrung in der Erforschung und Entwicklung von Machine-Learning- oder Deep-Learning-Lösungen, insbesondere in den Bereichen Computer Vision und multimodale Wahrnehmung
Fundierte Programmierkenntnisse in Python sowie Erfahrung mit Deep-Learning-Frameworks wie TensorFlow oder PyTorch
Erfahrung im Umgang mit Perzeptionsdaten aus LiDAR, Sonar und Kameras sowie fundierte Kenntnisse in der Sensordatenfusion
Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Herausforderungen zu lösen und innovative, forschungsbasierte Lösungen zu entwickeln
Hervorragende Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowie eine eigenständige Arbeitsweise bei komplexen Forschungsprojekten


Wir bieten


Angenehmes Arbeitsumfeld in einem hoch motivierten Team
Abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit hoher Eigenverantwortung
Unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Attraktives Gehaltspaket inklusive betrieblicher Altersvorsorge
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie regelmäßige Team-Events und Workshops


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

  • Attraktives Gehaltspaket inklusive betrieblicher Altersvorsorge
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie regelmäßige Team-Events und Workshops

Title: Software Engineer, Python
Description:
About Us

Engelhart was founded in 2013 by BTG Pactual Group as a commodities trading company. Its business model is “asset light” and highly diversified – giving it the ability to adapt effectively and nimbly to changing market conditions. It has assembled successful multidisciplinary teams, leveraging advanced fundamental analysis with deep quantitative and weather research capabilities. Its activities are underpinned by strong risk management practices and by powerful technology and operational excellence. Its exceptional teams have diverse global backgrounds and decades of experience, and are driven by a highly collaborative culture, across products and competencies.

In 2024, Engelhart acquired Trailstone, a global energy trading and technology company. The acquisition provides Engelhart with new expertise, analytics and proprietary technology which is used to provide risk management and optimisation services to manage the intermittency of renewable power generation for its client base. The acquisition also expanded Engelhart’s capabilities into physical natural gas across North America.

Its talented and experienced individuals work together according to its four company values: be bold, be collaborative, be proactive, be your best.

Software Engineer, Python

About the Role

We are looking for an experienced back-end Python software engineer to join our growing London office. This role will join the Trading & Commercial Development Team, developing best in class back-end services and microservices for our renewables trading platform, with Python.

The team is building a world-class product to help us scale and bring renewables to many more power markets in the world, while trading many more smaller electricity assets. This project is expanding at pace, following Trailstone’s merger with Engelhart Commodities Trading Partners. As a result, this role will be joining an international team with tangible impact on our platform's success from day one.

This will be a full-time role, owning the following responsibilities:


Design, develop and maintain containerised services for auction-based renewables trading.
Work in a cross-functional team with engineers, business analysts, traders, data engineers and data scientists.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in technology and continuously improve our code base, systems, and processes.
Mentor junior members in the team by emphasising code quality and conducting pull requests and code reviews.


About You

This person will be a seasoned developer, experienced working with time-sensitive hybrid-cloud systems, in order to deliver immediate impact to our growing renewables trading platform. This person will be working closely with commercial stakeholders on a regular basis, so experience collaborating with non-technical staff will help set someone up for success.

We believe the following essential skills & experiences will best set someone up for success in this role, therefore will be prioritising the following:


Significant relevant Python experience.
Strong knowledge of object-oriented, functional and asynchronous programming and design patterns.
Substantial SQL experience and understanding of relational database fundamentals.
A passion for delivering clean code and working with a test-driven mindset.
An appreciation of working in a hybrid-cloud and container-driven architecture (partly on-premise and partly AWS).
Domain knowledge in the energy or financial sector is highly desirable.
Desirable, but not essential: Experience developing services in C#




Our Tech Stack

Our tech stack includes Python (FastAPI, Pandas), AWS (ECS, Aurora), Redis, Docker, Atlassian (Jira, Bitbucket), SQL Server, C# and more.

Locations

This role can be based in either our Berlin or our London office, following the preference of the individual. You can find our office addresses on our website.

We believe in inclusivity and are therefore dedicated to ensuring all employees – across gender identity, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, life experience, background and more – feel welcome and included in the company. We promote diversity because we believe it is essential to our ability to think holistically.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Free lunch 2 days per week
Pension plan contributions
Public transportation subsidies
Bike leasing program
Monthly social events, massages, Thursday happy hours, sports teams
An awesome office in Friedrichshain, Berlin


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

Title: Data Scientist - Customer Data Platform
Description:
About The Opportunity

At Delivery Hero, you’ll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you’ll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

We are on the lookout for a full-stack Data Scientist to join one of our consumer product tribes that builds and scales the digital experience enjoyed by millions of consumers across 11 brands in 70+ countries. Our users can do a lot on our platform—order food delivery, buy groceries, find dine-in deals, discover new ad offerings from our partners, play games in our loyalty program (and more!)—and our goal is to make all this as delightful, personalised and seamless an experience as possible!

The Customer Insights squad (part of the Customer Data Platform domain) enables personalization by transforming consumer data into actionable insights and data-driven targeting, with the objective of increasing customer satisfaction, lifetime value and driving profitability globally, across all of Delivery Hero’s entities and markets.

This role is based in Berlin and the domain is structured as cross-functional squads that focus on different aspects of building a truly global Customer Data Platform.


Build and operate end-to-end data science models that focus on improving the customer journey through more effective targeting and segmentation.
Solve complex business problems by applying your knowledge and experience in advanced data science techniques.
Analyse and interpret data to gain insights and inform decision-making.
Collaborate with the CDP platform teams to build, deploy, monitor and operationalise production-grade data science models and services.
Collaborate with product specialists, and user experience teams to understand business processes, identify data and solution requirements.


What you need to be successful


Solid experience applying statistical and machine learning models.
Solid experience in SQL and Python.
Experience with productionalizing data science models and validating their online performance using testing methodologies (such as A/B testing).
Experience with cloud-based computing platforms, such as GCP or AWS as well as deep knowledge with MLOps best practices and tools.
You are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different backgrounds in an international environment.


Nice to have:


Proven track record of scientific work in your bachelors, masters or PhD in statistics, physics, economics, mathematics, data science or similar.
Hands-on experience in collaborating with marketing teams, e.g. for incentive optimisation.
Experience in reinforcement learning approaches such as multi-armed bandit (MAB).
Previous experience working in a cross-functional platform team/organisation.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Campaigns
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help us improve Bolt’s Campaigns

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 50+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building models for predicting the probability of the user booking under specific circumstances. You will work on customer segmentation: discover rider, driver, and eater segments for efficient campaign targeting. As a Data Scientist, you will be developing a system for automating promo campaigns setup and scaling it for millions of Bolt customers. You will be engaged in designing optimal experimental setup for comparing different campaigns targeting methodologies and user behavior dynamics. You will work on prioritising user acquisition channels using analytical and machine learning approaches.

Your daily adventures will include:


Machine learning and statistical model development and its deployment into a production environment)
Studying historical user behaviour and building models for optimal users’ discount allocation
Developing a system for automating regular promo campaign setups)
Setting up A/B tests, collecting, interpreting its results, and communicating to stakeholders)
Working with a technical stack consisting of Python, Docker, Presto, SageMaker, Airflow)
Collaborating with data analysts, data scientists, product managers, and software engineers in feature teams )



About you:


Industry experience in data science and machine learning (4+ years recommended), with deep knowledge of statistics, probability, and causal inference
Proficient in setting A/B tests and interpreting results, with a strong understanding of statistical hypothesis testing
Track record of deploying models to production and effectively measuring their impact
Experience in writing complex SQL queries and mapping business/product problems to data science frameworks
Strong product thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to communicate, persuade, and collaborate effectively
Proactive, self-driven mindset, able to take initiative with minimal supervision and work well in a team



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 2 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.
Show more

Title: Data Science Developer (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir zeichnen uns durch Flexibilität und Begeisterung gegenüber technologischen Trends und Innovationen aus. Bei Dataciders ixto erwartet Dich ein sehr gutes teamorientiertes Betriebsklima und eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre mit einem motivierten, vielseitigen Team aus unterschiedlichen Bereichen wie Informationstechnik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, uvm. Du erhältst die Chance, das Unternehmen und die Unternehmenskultur durch Deinen Beitrag und Deine Ideen ständig weiterzuentwickeln.

DATA SCIENCE DEVELOPER (M/W/D)

Festangestellung Dataciders ixto GmbH, Vollzeit

Was Dich in Deiner neuen Aufgabe erwartet


Innovative Projekte zu Machine Learning und Künstlicher Intelligenz
Öffentlich geförderte Forschungsprojekte in gesellschaftlich relevanten Zukunftsthemen
Projektrealisierungen in State-of-the-Art Technologien
Unterstützung bei der Implementierung und Bereitstellung moderner Cloud- und Microservice-Architekturen


Was wir uns von Dir wünschen


Hohe Lern- und Begeisterungsfähigkeit für Daten und Cloud-Technologien
Abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Berufsausbildung - wichtig sind uns Deine ausgeprägten Fähigkeiten in analytischem Denken
Kenntnisse in einer der folgenden Sprachen: Python, Java, PowerShell, C# oder JavaScript
Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Plattformen wie Microsoft Azure, AWS und GCP sind von Vorteil
Erfahrungen im Bereich Datenbankentwicklung sind von Vorteil
Selbstbewusstes Auftreten, Kundenorientierung und Kommunikationsstärke
Teamfähigkeit und Reisebereitschaft
Sprachkenntnisse: Deutsch (C1), Englisch (C1)


Was wir Dir bieten

Wir sind ein führender Anbieter für die Realisierung maßgeschneiderter Daten-Lösungen, welche die Grundlage für wichtige Entscheidungen in Fachabteilungen und unternehmensweit bilden.


Ein junges Team aus wissbegierigen Talenten und erfahrenen Beratern
Eine Arbeitsumgebung, die Eigenverantwortung und individuelle Entwicklung fördert
Ständiger Wissensaustausch und eine Team-Kultur, die persönliches Wachstum fördert
Zahlreiche Teamevents


Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann bewirb Dich jetzt!

Title: Data Scientist - Customer Logistics, Choice
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist - Customer Logistics, Choice to join the Logistics Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In our Logistics Team, you’ll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

The Customer Logistics tribe’s mission is to build products that make it easy for local brands to run efficient operations and deliver a delightful order experience to customers so they order on repeat. The tribe comprises teams of skilled analysts, engineers, and scientists working together to deliver data solutions affecting every customer journey across all of Delivery Hero’s 70+ markets.


Drive the development and implementation of statistical, machine learning, and optimization models for choice optimization, rider fleet busyness and travel time prediction, and demand control. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance the efficiency and performance of the machine learning models in across the vertical.
Analyse large-scale datasets to understand and identify opportunities by deploying sophisticated statistical techniques to improve decision-making in the domain.
Work on research initiatives to explore emerging trends and technologies in machine learning and data science, contributing to the advancement of Delivery Hero's digital products and algorithms. Stay informed about industry developments and incorporate new methodologies and best practices into our data science workflows.


What you need to be successful


You excel at modelling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver value to the business.
You have expertise in building and training advanced machine learning models with strong knowledge of the Python data toolkit ideally centring around Pandas, SQL, Sklearn, and PySpark.
Through the fluent use of SQL queries, you are able to explore our data universe and gather data to support your analysis and the development of machine-learning solutions.
You write clean, production-level code and effectively use software versioning with Git.
You are familiar with deploying and developing in cloud systems, ideally with experience in GCP and bigquery.
You love to learn and are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different tech teams in a diverse environment.


Nice to have:


Proven experience in addressing large-scale optimization problems (linear or mixed integer programming) is a strong asset.
Hands-on experience in creating causal models and deploying them in production is a plus.
Experience in designing and analysing advanced products/models experiments (switchback tests, quasi-experiments, non-standard A/B tests etc) is a plus.
Experience in working on logistics product development would be a great benefit.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.




Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

HTML:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist - Customer Logistics, Choice to join the Logistics Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In our Logistics Team, you’ll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

The Customer Logistics tribe’s mission is to build products that make it easy for local brands to run efficient operations and deliver a delightful order experience to customers so they order on repeat. The tribe comprises teams of skilled analysts, engineers, and scientists working together to deliver data solutions affecting every customer journey across all of Delivery Hero’s 70+ markets.

  • Drive the development and implementation of statistical, machine learning, and optimization models for choice optimization, rider fleet busyness and travel time prediction, and demand control. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance the efficiency and performance of the machine learning models in across the vertical.
  • Analyse large-scale datasets to understand and identify opportunities by deploying sophisticated statistical techniques to improve decision-making in the domain.
  • Work on research initiatives to explore emerging trends and technologies in machine learning and data science, contributing to the advancement of Delivery Hero's digital products and algorithms. Stay informed about industry developments and incorporate new methodologies and best practices into our data science workflows.

What you need to be successful

  • You excel at modelling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver value to the business.
  • You have expertise in building and training advanced machine learning models with strong knowledge of the Python data toolkit ideally centring around Pandas, SQL, Sklearn, and PySpark.
  • Through the fluent use of SQL queries, you are able to explore our data universe and gather data to support your analysis and the development of machine-learning solutions.
  • You write clean, production-level code and effectively use software versioning with Git.
  • You are familiar with deploying and developing in cloud systems, ideally with experience in GCP and bigquery.
  • You love to learn and are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
  • You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different tech teams in a diverse environment.

Nice to have:

  • Proven experience in addressing large-scale optimization problems (linear or mixed integer programming) is a strong asset.
  • Hands-on experience in creating causal models and deploying them in production is a plus.
  • Experience in designing and analysing advanced products/models experiments (switchback tests, quasi-experiments, non-standard A/B tests etc) is a plus.
  • Experience in working on logistics product development would be a great benefit.

Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.



Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Berlin/Hybrid

Salary: €90,000-€100,000

Interview process: 3 Stages, 1 x 30 minute initial call, 1 x take home GenAI task, 1 x Deep technical interview to present task and meet team.




We're excited to bring you this role for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer for a client of ours in Berlin. The team we're hiring for is a leading team in AI, specializing in GenAI and LLMs. They have a proven track record of success, having deployed Transformers-based models in production for over 5 years and launched a groundbreaking GenAI-powered chatbot in 2024.

They leverage a large dataset to drive innovation and continuously improve their solutions.




Tech Stack: Python, PyTorch, AWS, Docker, and cutting-edge foundation models like LLaMA, GPT, and BERT.




Your Tasks

Develop and deploy cutting-edge GenAI solutions, including LLMs for various applications.
Fine-tune and adapt existing LLMs to specific business needs.
Research and implement novel LLM architectures and training techniques.
Drive innovation across the product lifecycle, leveraging the power of GenAI.




Your Profile

4 + years of experience working with NLPs and GenAI, with hands-on experience with LLMs (e.g., LLaMA, GPT, BERT).
Expertise in Python, cloud (AWS), and deep learning frameworks (PyTorch).
Proven ability to develop and deploy production-level LLM applications.
Passion for developing and deploying impactful AI solutions.
Strong German language skills
Show more

Title: Founding AI Engineer
Description:
Consultants worldwide spend millions of hours every day creating presentations. Zapdeck is set to revolutionize this task with powerful AI software that empowers users to create professionally designed presentations in minutes.

At the heart of Zapdeck is an innovative agentic AI technology—the first capable of converting text directly into professional slide designs. Our product features an intuitive editor that enables seamless collaboration, helps users craft cohesive storylines, and transforms them into polished slides ready for export.

The presentation creation industry is a multi-billion-dollar market undergoing significant disruption due to advancements in generative AI. Zapdeck has secured substantial pre-seed funding and is building partnerships with leading companies in the industry. We are now on track to becoming one of Germany's leading AI start-ups.

We are seeking an experienced Founding AI Engineer (full-time) to join us as one of the first employees and help build Zapdeck from the ground up. The ideal candidate is motivated to step up to the mark, build radical new technology that will disrupt the industry, and accompany our company over the coming investment rounds.

You will be part of a team with extensive experience. Our co-founder / CEO Frederik is a former consultant at BCG and our co-founder / CTO Riccardo is the former technical CPO of InsurTech startup INZMO. The role offers a high level of creative freedom and responsibility, combined with an attractive equity share in the company (VSOP).

Tasks


Develop AI features: Further develop our agentic AI solution with fine-tuned LLMs, Information Retrieval, classification models and other methodologies.
Evolve backend: Develop our AI backend based on Python following clean code practices and enterprise-level architectural design patterns.
Build asynchronous systems: Build and maintain asynchronous systems for automation and bulk use cases.
Manage data and models: Collect and preprocess data, oversee model lifecycle management, including version control and performance monitoring.
Drive innovation: Stay up to date with the latest advancements in AI and contribute to our AI and product strategy to maintain the competitive edge.



Requirements

Professional requirements


2–4 years of experience in AI/ML development, with hands-on expertise in training and fine-tuning ML models, including LLMs.
Solid experience with machine learning libraries and frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face, and strong skills in Python.
Experience in collecting, preprocessing, and managing data pipelines for training, with knowledge of tools like pandas or NumPy and REST APIs.
Bonus: Familiarity with versioning, deployment, and monitoring of ML models in production environments, incl. managing AI related cloud infrastructure.
Bonus: Experience with Gen AI applications in media and design, with AI-powered enterprise software, or agentic AI solutions.



Other Requirements


Residency and valid work authorization in Germany, preferably Berlin. Please kindly refrain from applying if you are not currently living in Germany.
Fluency in English, our main business language
Availability to start within a short time frame (e.g., within 1 month)



Benefits


Attractive package of a monthly salary and VSOP shares in a fast-growing AI startup that could be worth several million in a few years.
Opportunity to work independently and creatively in a young and ambitious team team and see the direct impact of your work.
Hybrid working model with the option to work from home or from our office in Berlin Mitte, and flexible working hours.
Possibility to build your own team and take on more responsibility in a managerial role in a short space of time.
Regular team events as well as free snacks and drinks in our office Berlin Mitte :)



Join us to create a disruptive AI product and shape a globally successful company 🚀
Show more

Title: Staff Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Staff Data Scientist at Aignostics, you will play a crucial role in shaping the scientific and technical direction and integrity of our data science platform, projects, and products. You will work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art for digital pathology. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving scientific and technical excellence across all data science teams, ensuring we deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that transform complex biomedical data into actionable insights for cancer research and diagnostics. You will work within the Data Science Staff team.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ machine learners, software engineers, applied scientists, pathologists, and biologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive, and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup, you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take on significant responsibilities, and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

Data Science or Machine Learning? We do both at Aignostics, and are convinced that both are needed for success. You can expect to work on a broad spectrum of topics from deep learning with foundation and other state-of-the-art models on terabytes of data to projects in low sample regimes and very high-dimensional and multimodal data. We have nearly all the data science challenges you can think of for you!

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


You identify promising new directions based on the scientific literature, results from in-house experiments, and your own novel ideas.
You are able to turn these ideas into reality by describing, presenting, designing, implementing, and experimenting with novel machine learning architectures, models, and variants of existing models
You analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
You run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments on a day to day basis
You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other Data Science teams involved in machine learning and translational research
You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
Educate mid-level and junior data scientists to bring them up to the next level
Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code


What We Are Looking For


Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating large scale distributed machine learning trainings; 8+ years of experience with this
Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)


Ideally, you also …


Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


About Us

aignostics.com
Show more
